analyzed: 'di'i bshad pa ni /
translated: This is explained by the following:

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba sprel ba na yang de dag mngon par 'grub par nye bar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba 'dis bshad pa yin no //üîΩgang gi phyir nying mtshams sbyor bar byed pa des na yang nying mtshams sbyor zhing sprel ba mngon par grub pa 'dzin par byed pas lus thams cad yongs su gzungs ba byas pas 'gyur te /
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba sprel ba na yang de dag mngon par 'grub par nye bar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba 'dis bshad pa yin no // gang gi phyir nying mtshams sbyor bar byed pa des na yang nying mtshams sbyor zhing sprel ba mngon par grub pa 'dzin par byed pas lus thams cad yongs su gzungs ba byas pas 'gyur te /
translated: When it links with the next existence, it also appropriates the establishment of those.üîΩBecause it links with the next existence, it also links with the next existence and appropriates the establishment of the next existence.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la lus thams cad kyi bag chags kun tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la lus thams cad kyi bag chags kun tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The entire body is appropriated because the latent impressions of the entire body are present in the store consciousness.

original: de dag mngon par grub pa ste /üîΩde'i mngon par 'grub pa ni de mngon par 'grub pa'o //üîΩnye bar 'dzin pa ni de dag mngon par 'grub pa nye bar len te /
analyzed: de dag mngon par grub pa ste / de'i mngon par 'grub pa ni de mngon par 'grub pa'o // nye bar 'dzin pa ni de dag mngon par 'grub pa nye bar len te /
translated: The establishment of thoseüîΩis the establishment of that.üîΩAppropriation is the appropriation of the establishment of those.

original: de'i nye bar 'dzin pa yang dag gi dngos po bskyed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i nye bar 'dzin pa yang dag gi dngos po bskyed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The generation of the entity of that appropriation is the generation of the entity of the establishment of those.

original: don 'dis ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa len pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid du yang brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: don 'dis ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa len pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid du yang brjod pa yin no //
translated: This point also shows that the foundation consciousness is the appropriating consciousness.

original: yang de ni sems zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: yang de ni sems zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it is also called mind.

original: zhes bya ba'i sems nyid ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sems nyid ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The mind itself is the foundation consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i don sna tshogs nyid du dmigs pa ltar 'di'i don yang sna tshogs nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i don sna tshogs nyid du dmigs pa ltar 'di'i don yang sna tshogs nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
translated: Just as the meaning of the mental consciousness is the apprehension of various objects, its meaning is also various.

original: de la mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen byed pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par shes pa gang de ma thag par 'gags pa nyid ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur bas de ni yid gcig go //
analyzed: de la mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen byed pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par shes pa gang de ma thag par 'gags pa nyid ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur bas de ni yid gcig go //
translated: In this regard, the consciousness that has just ceased is the cause of the mental consciousness because it acts as the equivalent and immediately antecedent condition of the mental consciousness.

original: gnyis pa ni nyon mongs pa bzhis nyon mongs pa can gyi yid de /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni nyon mongs pa bzhis nyon mongs pa can gyi yid de /
translated: The second is the afflicted mind, which is afflicted by the four afflictions.

original: de ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba ste /
analyzed: de ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba ste /
translated: It is the view of the perishable composite,

original: bdag nyid du mngon par zhen pa dang / gang gi dbang gi nga'o snyam du nga rgyal te /
analyzed: bdag nyid du mngon par zhen pa dang / gang gi dbang gi nga'o snyam du nga rgyal te /
translated: which is the manifest clinging to the perishable composite as a self and the pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: bdag nyid mtho'o zhes pa dang / yang de la mi bden pa'i bdag la sred pa'i bdag nyid la chags pa dang / gsum po de dag gi rgyu ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid mtho'o zhes pa dang / yang de la mi bden pa'i bdag la sred pa'i bdag nyid la chags pa dang / gsum po de dag gi rgyu ma rig pa ste /
translated: The cause of these three is ignorance.

original: ma rig pa mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa mi shes pa'o //
translated: Ignorance is non-knowledge.

original: gang gnas gcig pos ni bskyed pa /
analyzed: gang gnas gcig pos ni bskyed pa /
translated: One of these two is the generating cause,üîΩand the other is the defiling cause.

original: @128b gnyis pos ni nyon mongs pa can du byas pa ste zhes bya ba de la 'gags ma thag pa'i rnam par shes pa yid ces brjod pas ni rnam par shes pa thams cad 'byung ba'i skabs sbyin pas skye ba'i rten yin no //
analyzed: @128b gnyis pos ni nyon mongs pa can du byas pa ste zhes bya ba de la 'gags ma thag pa'i rnam par shes pa yid ces brjod pas ni rnam par shes pa thams cad 'byung ba'i skabs sbyin pas skye ba'i rten yin no //
translated: The immediately antecedent condition is the basis of arising, because it gives rise to all consciousnesses.

original: gnyis pa nyon mongs pa can ni kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa nyon mongs pa can ni kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa ste /
translated: The second, the defiling cause, is the defiler.

original: gang phyir dge ba'i sems la yang bdag go zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang phyir dge ba'i sems la yang bdag go zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, The self is in a virtuous mind, and so on.

original: yul la rnam par rig pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: yul la rnam par rig pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is the awareness of objects.

original: de ma thag pa'i rten byed pa dang / ngar sems pa'i phyir yid kyi rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rten byed pa dang / ngar sems pa'i phyir yid kyi rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The two types of mental consciousness are the immediately antecedent condition and the basis of the thought of I.

original: de la yul la 'dzin pa'i don gyis na rnam par shes pa ni skabs ster ba'i don gyis ni yid gcig go //
analyzed: de la yul la 'dzin pa'i don gyis na rnam par shes pa ni skabs ster ba'i don gyis ni yid gcig go //
translated: Consciousness is the sense of the object being grasped, and mind is the sense of the occasion.

original: bdag tu nga rgyal la sogs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i don gyis na gnyis pa nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do //
analyzed: bdag tu nga rgyal la sogs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i don gyis na gnyis pa nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do //
translated: The second is the defiled mind, which is the sense of the defilement of self-pride, etc.

original: gzhan yang gang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid de med na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid de med na /
translated: Moreover, if there were no defiled mind,

original: gang gi rgyu can yid dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi rgyu can yid dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: the mind and the active consciousnesses would not arise, because they would have no cause.

original: rnam par shes pa smos pas yid kyi gnyis pa yang smos pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa smos pas yid kyi gnyis pa yang smos pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: By the word consciousness, the second mind is also included,

original: rgyu gang gis yid gang 'gags pa de nyid yid ces brjod na thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu gang gis yid gang 'gags pa de nyid yid ces brjod na thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause of the mind is called mind, and because it is obtained.

original: yang 'di'i nges pa'i tshig ni rnam pa sna tshogs kyi chos kyi bag chags kyi sa bon gyis gang zhing nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang 'di'i nges pa'i tshig ni rnam pa sna tshogs kyi chos kyi bag chags kyi sa bon gyis gang zhing nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, its definition is that it is defiled, because it is filled and defiled by the seeds of the propensities of various dharmas.

original: de la rnam pa sna tshogs ni rnam pa tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam pa sna tshogs ni rnam pa tha dad pa'o //
translated: Various means different kinds.

original: chos kyi bag chags kyi sa bon zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gis nus pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: chos kyi bag chags kyi sa bon zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gis nus pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The ‚Äúseed of the instinct for Dharma‚Äù is the cause of the special potency.

original: gang zhing zhes bya ba ni shin tu gang zhing bsags zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhing zhes bya ba ni shin tu gang zhing bsags zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe field‚Äù means the field that is well-cultivated.üîΩBecause it is the repository of all subtle knowables.

original: shes bya phra mo kun tu bsdus pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni de phra mo yang yin la shes bya yang yin pas shes bya phra mo ste /
analyzed: shes bya phra mo kun tu bsdus pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni de phra mo yang yin la shes bya yang yin pas shes bya phra mo ste /
translated: It is a subtle knowable because it is subtle and a knowable.

original: shes bya phra mo'i khongs su gtogs pa'am /
analyzed: shes bya phra mo'i khongs su gtogs pa'am /
translated: It is included among subtle knowables,

original: rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: or it is difficult to understand.

original: nyan thos ni shes bya thams cad shes pa'i don du spro ba med kyi /
analyzed: nyan thos ni shes bya thams cad shes pa'i don du spro ba med kyi /
translated: The Sravakas are not interested in knowing all knowables,

original: bdag gi don 'ba' zhig gi rgyur de dag ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rags pa nyid sdug bsngal la sogs pa shes pas spong ngo //
analyzed: bdag gi don 'ba' zhig gi rgyur de dag ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rags pa nyid sdug bsngal la sogs pa shes pas spong ngo //
translated: but only in the cause of their own welfare. They eliminate the gross obscurations of the passions by knowing suffering and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag dang gzhan rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag dang gzhan rnams kyi'o //
translated: The Bodhisattvas are interested in the welfare of both themselves and others.

original: yang de ltar grags pa de sgrub pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang de ltar grags pa de sgrub pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the practice of that which is thus renowned?

original: de med du zin na ma rig pa ma 'dres pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med du zin na ma rig pa ma 'dres pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did not exist, there would be the fault that there would be no unmixed ignorance.

original: yang ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is unmixed ignorance?

original: gnyen po ma skyes pa na de kho na nyid shes pa la sgrib par byed pa ste /üîΩde yang rnam par shes pa lnga la ni ldan pa @129a * //
analyzed: gnyen po ma skyes pa na de kho na nyid shes pa la sgrib par byed pa ste / de yang rnam par shes pa lnga la ni ldan pa @129a * //
translated: It is that which obscures the knowledge of reality when its antidote has not arisen.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is not associated with the five consciousnesses,üîΩbecause it does not obscure the state of those consciousnesses.

original: de la gnas pa la mi sgrib pa'i phyir gang na gnyen po 'byung ba yod pa de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang 'byung ba yin no zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: de la gnas pa la mi sgrib pa'i phyir gang na gnyen po 'byung ba yod pa de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang 'byung ba yin no zhes bya bas so //
translated: Where there is the arising of an antidote, there is also the arising of an opposing factor.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa de la yang med de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa de la yang med de /
translated: It is also not in the nondefiled mental consciousness,

original: nyon mongs pa can nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it is defiled.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni gzhan du nyon mongs pa dang / kun tu spyod par mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni gzhan du nyon mongs pa dang / kun tu spyod par mi 'grub bo //
translated: It is not established that the nondefiled is the universal activity of the defilements.

original: de lta na nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa can du yid kyi rnam par shes pa khas len na shin tu nyon mongs pa can nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas ji ltar sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i sems 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa can du yid kyi rnam par shes pa khas len na shin tu nyon mongs pa can nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas ji ltar sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i sems 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: How could virtuous minds such as generosity arise?

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa las te /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa las te /
translated: They arise from minds concomitant with it.

original: yang gang dge ba dang mtshungs par 'jug pa'i yid yod pas de la de mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur gyi yang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid la ni gnyen po'i phyogs 'dren par mi rigs so //
analyzed: yang gang dge ba dang mtshungs par 'jug pa'i yid yod pas de la de mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur gyi yang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid la ni gnyen po'i phyogs 'dren par mi rigs so //
translated: Since there is a mind concomitant with virtue, it is concomitant with virtue. It is not tenable that the antidote to the afflicted mind is drawn in.

original: yang gang la nyon mongs pa tsam gyi yid dang mtshungs par 'jug pa dge ba'i sems yod na /
analyzed: yang gang la nyon mongs pa tsam gyi yid dang mtshungs par 'jug pa dge ba'i sems yod na /
translated: If there is a virtuous mind that engages in the mental afflictions alone,

original: de dang des drangs pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs skyes pa na cig shos 'gag pa yin pas 'di la skyon med do //
analyzed: de dang des drangs pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs skyes pa na cig shos 'gag pa yin pas 'di la skyon med do //
translated: then when the antidote to that is drawn in and arises, the other ceases.

original: lnga po dag dang chos mtshungs dang ste /
analyzed: lnga po dag dang chos mtshungs dang ste /
translated: The five are similar to the phenomena element.

original: ji ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa lnga po dag la mig la sogs pa lnga po dag rten mtshungs par yod pa de bzhin du yid kyi rnam par shes pa la yang de dang mtshungs par 'gyur ba'i rten yod pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa lnga po dag la mig la sogs pa lnga po dag rten mtshungs par yod pa de bzhin du yid kyi rnam par shes pa la yang de dang mtshungs par 'gyur ba'i rten yod pa yin no //
translated: Just as the five sense consciousnesses, visual consciousness, etc., have the five material sense organs, eye, etc., as their support, in the same way, mental consciousness has a support that is similar to them.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i bye brag dang ste /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i bye brag dang ste /
translated: The difference is due to the distinction of meditative attainment.

original: gang la nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yod pa de ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste /üîΩde yod pas so //
analyzed: gang la nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yod pa de ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste / de yod pas so //
translated: In the meditative attainment of non-perception, the afflicted mind exists, but not the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: gzhan la ni de med de /üîΩde ni khyad par yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la ni de med de / de ni khyad par yin no //
translated: Because the latter is superior to the former.

original: gzhan du na gnyi ga la yid kyi rnam par shes pa kun tu rgyu ba med na bye brag med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na gnyi ga la yid kyi rnam par shes pa kun tu rgyu ba med na bye brag med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if both meditative attainments were without the mental consciousness, there would be no difference between them.

original: nge tshig med pa'i skyon du 'gyur /
analyzed: nge tshig med pa'i skyon du 'gyur /
translated: The fault of the absence of verbal expression would occur.

original: gang 'di skad du ngar 'dzin pas na yid ces bya ba'i nges pa'i tshig de skad du brjod pa'i gzhi gang yin /
analyzed: gang 'di skad du ngar 'dzin pas na yid ces bya ba'i nges pa'i tshig de skad du brjod pa'i gzhi gang yin /
translated: What is the basis for the etymological explanation of the word manas, which is explained as that which thinks?

original: rnam par shes pa drug po 'gags ma thag pa'i rnam par shes pa la ni 'di ltar mi brjod de 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug po 'gags ma thag pa'i rnam par shes pa la ni 'di ltar mi brjod de 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The consciousness that has just ceased of the six consciousnesses is not so described, because it has ceased.

original: 'du shes med pa'i skye ba'i rgyun thob pa na ngar 'dzin pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i skye ba'i rgyun thob pa na ngar 'dzin pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: If the stream of birth in the realm of non-percipient beings is obtained, the fault of the absence of the view of the self would occur.

original: 'di ltar de'i dus skabs na nyon mongs pa can gyi yid med na ngar 'dzin pa med par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i dus skabs na nyon mongs pa can gyi yid med na ngar 'dzin pa med par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if the afflicted mind does not exist at that time, the view of the self would arise without the view of the self.

original: de lta na ni 'phags pas @129b kyang smad par mi 'gyur na de ni smad pa nyid yin pas des na de ni de na yod pa nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'phags pas @129b kyang smad par mi 'gyur na de ni smad pa nyid yin pas des na de ni de na yod pa nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: But if that were so, it would not be censured by the noble ones, but it is censured. Therefore, it should be understood that it exists there.

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang ldan par ni ste /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang ldan par ni ste /
translated: It is associated with the view of the self.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa sbyin pa la yang ngar 'dzin pa dang ldan pa nyid do //üîΩngar 'dzin pa dang ldan pa yang ma rig pa med par mi rigs la /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa sbyin pa la yang ngar 'dzin pa dang ldan pa nyid do // ngar 'dzin pa dang ldan pa yang ma rig pa med par mi rigs la /
translated: It is also associated with the view of the self in the giving of gifts such as generosity.üîΩIt is not reasonable that the view of the self is associated with ignorance.

original: ma rig pa yang rten med par ma yin zhing /
analyzed: ma rig pa yang rten med par ma yin zhing /
translated: And ignorance does not occur without a basis.

original: rten yang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid med na gzhan med de /
analyzed: rten yang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid med na gzhan med de /
translated: And if there is no afflicted mind, there is no other basis.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir 'bad pas de dag gi phyir bstan to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir 'bad pas de dag gi phyir bstan to //
translated: Because they have abandoned the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, they are taught for their sake.

original: skye dgu kun gzhi la kun tu dga' ba zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: skye dgu kun gzhi la kun tu dga' ba zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúall beings delight in the foundation consciousness‚Äù is a teaching.

original: da ltar dang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus gsum gyi go rims bzhin du tshig lhag ma rnams kyis ni bshad do //
analyzed: da ltar dang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus gsum gyi go rims bzhin du tshig lhag ma rnams kyis ni bshad do //
translated: The remaining phrases explain the three times, past, future, and present, in order.

original: don gzhan yang kun gzhi la kun tu dga' ba ni de ltar ro //
analyzed: don gzhan yang kun gzhi la kun tu dga' ba ni de ltar ro //
translated: Another interpretation is that ‚Äúall beings delight in the foundation consciousness‚Äù refers to the present.

original: kun gzhi la dga' ba ni 'das pa'i dus su ste /üîΩgang sngar kun gzhi la dga' ba las de ltar kun gzhi las yang dag par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kun gzhi la dga' ba ni 'das pa'i dus su ste / gang sngar kun gzhi la dga' ba las de ltar kun gzhi las yang dag par 'byung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúDelight in the foundation consciousness‚Äù refers to the past.üîΩIn the past, they delighted in the foundation consciousness, and in that way they arose from the foundation consciousness.

original: gang kun gzhi la dga' ba dang / kun gzhi las yang dag par 'byung ba las ma 'ongs pa'i dus su kun gzhi la mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: gang kun gzhi la dga' ba dang / kun gzhi las yang dag par 'byung ba las ma 'ongs pa'i dus su kun gzhi la mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: Those who delight in the foundation consciousness and arise from the foundation consciousness delight in the foundation consciousness in the future.

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos ni man ngag ji lta ba bzhin du byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos ni man ngag ji lta ba bzhin du byed pa'o //
translated: The Dharma that accords with the Dharma is the practice of the instructions just as they are.

original: rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes kyang 'byung ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes kyang 'byung ste /
translated: The root consciousness also occurs.

original: rnam grangs des kyang de nyid bstan te /
analyzed: rnam grangs des kyang de nyid bstan te /
translated: By this synonym, it is also taught.üîΩIt is like a tree that is based on its root.

original: rtsa ba la brten pa'i shing ljon pa bzhin no zhes brjod pa la de la rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rgyur gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: rtsa ba la brten pa'i shing ljon pa bzhin no zhes brjod pa la de la rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rgyur gyur ba nyid do //
translated: The root consciousness is the cause of all consciousnesses.

original: dper na shing gi rtsa ba yal ga la sogs pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: dper na shing gi rtsa ba yal ga la sogs pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: For example, the root of a tree is the cause of the branches, etc.üîΩIf there is no root, the branches, etc., do not occur.

original: rtsa ba med na yal ga la sogs pa mi 'byung ba bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yang rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid do ;
analyzed: rtsa ba med na yal ga la sogs pa mi 'byung ba bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yang rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid do ;
translated: The store consciousness is the root consciousness.

original: /'khor ba ji srid pa'i phung po rnams zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: /'khor ba ji srid pa'i phung po rnams zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The aggregates that last as long as cyclic existence occurs.üîΩBy this synonym, it is also taught.

original: rnam grangs des kyang zhes bya ba la 'khor ba ji srid pa'i phung po nyid kyang de nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam grangs des kyang zhes bya ba la 'khor ba ji srid pa'i phung po nyid kyang de nyid yin no //
translated: The aggregates that last as long as cyclic existence is also that.

original: gang gi phyir la lar te gzugs med pa'i khams su gzugs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir la lar te gzugs med pa'i khams su gzugs so //
translated: because, in some places, i.e., in the formless realm, there is form;

original: res 'ga' zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa kha cig gi gnas skabs su ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa kha cig gi gnas skabs su ste /
translated: and, at some times, i.e., in the state of certain meditative attainments,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug par ro //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug par ro //
translated: the attainment of non-perception.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la de'i sa bon ni rgyun mi 'chad ces bya ba la /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la de'i sa bon ni rgyun mi 'chad ces bya ba la /
translated: The seed of that form in the store-consciousness is uninterrupted,

original: gzugs dang sems kyi bag chags kyi rgyu gang las yang srid pa'i gzugs dang sems dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro //üîΩkun gzhi rnam par @130a * //
analyzed: gzugs dang sems kyi bag chags kyi rgyu gang las yang srid pa'i gzugs dang sems dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro // kun gzhi rnam par @130a * //
translated: from which seed there is the production of form and mind in a new existence.üîΩThe great path of the store-consciousness is not abandoned,

original: shes pa'i lam po che gtong ba zhes bya ba ni shin tu rgyas par byas zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: shes pa'i lam po che gtong ba zhes bya ba ni shin tu rgyas par byas zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: i.e., it is thoroughly made, is the meaning.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yongs su bzung nas rnam par 'jog pa de ni shin tu mdzes pa yin no //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yongs su bzung nas rnam par 'jog pa de ni shin tu mdzes pa yin no //
translated: The establishment of the store-consciousness is very beautiful when it is accepted.üîΩThose who are not confused about that establish the store-consciousness,

original: de la ma rmongs pa rnams kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la ma rmongs pa rnams kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who are not confused about this will understand the presentation of the foundation consciousness.üîΩ

original: de la ma rmongs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa dag la des bstan pa'o //üîΩde la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ni de bas na shin tu 'thad pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de la ma rmongs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa dag la des bstan pa'o // de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ni de bas na shin tu 'thad pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The bodhisattvas who are not confused about that are the ones to whom it is taught.üîΩThe presentation of the storehouse consciousness begins with ‚ÄúTherefore, it is quite reasonable . . . ‚Äù

original: de bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa kun gzhi nyid du ches legs par rnam par gzhag pa grub po zhes bya ba'i bar gyis so //
analyzed: de bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa kun gzhi nyid du ches legs par rnam par gzhag pa grub po zhes bya ba'i bar gyis so //
translated: and concludes with ‚ÄúTherefore, the storehouse consciousness is quite well established as the storehouse itself. ‚Äù

original: de la ngan 'gro zhes bya ba ni yi dags dang dud 'gro dang / dmyal ba ni ngan 'gro'o //
analyzed: de la ngan 'gro zhes bya ba ni yi dags dang dud 'gro dang / dmyal ba ni ngan 'gro'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBad destinies‚Äù refers to hungry ghosts, animals, and hell beings.

original: shin tu sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni las kyi 'bras bu shin tu mi 'dod pa can gyi ngan 'gro rnams te /
analyzed: shin tu sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni las kyi 'bras bu shin tu mi 'dod pa can gyi ngan 'gro rnams te /
translated: ‚ÄúExtremely painful‚Äù refers to bad destinies that are the results of extremely undesirable actions.

original: gang yang der res 'ga' bde ba'i tshor ba 'byung ba de ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin gyi rnam par smin pa nyid ni der skyes pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal kho na'o //
analyzed: gang yang der res 'ga' bde ba'i tshor ba 'byung ba de ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin gyi rnam par smin pa nyid ni der skyes pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal kho na'o //
translated: Even though there is sometimes a feeling of pleasure that arises there, it is a causally concordant result, not a ripening result. For those born there, it is only suffering.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba 'dod chags dang bcas pa yang bsam gtan bzhi pa yang chad gong ma la med de /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba 'dod chags dang bcas pa yang bsam gtan bzhi pa yang chad gong ma la med de /
translated: Pleasant feeling accompanied by attachment does not exist above the fourth meditation.

original: de dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams dang mi mthun pa yin pas /üîΩbsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad gong ma ste /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams dang mi mthun pa yin pas / bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad gong ma ste /
translated: It is incompatible with the sentient beings who possess it.üîΩThe fourth meditation and what is above it is higher.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gong ma la yang ngo //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gong ma la yang ngo //
translated: It is the fourth meditation and what is above it.

original: de dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni der skyes pa zhes pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni der skyes pa zhes pa rnams so //
translated: Those who possess it are those born there.üîΩFrom the beginning, the foundation consciousness is accepted as an internal entity.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la nang gi dngos por khas blangs pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas de rnam par zhig por 'dod pa ni nam yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar la /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la nang gi dngos por khas blangs pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas de rnam par zhig por 'dod pa ni nam yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar la /
translated: It is never destroyed, even when it is destroyed.

original: de la nang gi bdag gi dngos por khas blangs pa smos pa ni nang gi bdag nyid khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: de la nang gi bdag gi dngos por khas blangs pa smos pa ni nang gi bdag nyid khas blangs pa'o //
translated: In this regard, the mention of the internal entity that is accepted is the acceptance of the internal self.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po rnam par gzhig par 'dod pa ni tshor sdug bsngal dang bral bar gsol ba 'debs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po rnam par gzhig par 'dod pa ni tshor sdug bsngal dang bral bar gsol ba 'debs so //
translated: The desire to destroy the aggregate of suffering is the request to be separated from the suffering of feeling.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bdag tu chags pas bcings pa zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bdag go zhes khas blangs nas sred pas bcings pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bdag tu chags pas bcings pa zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bdag go zhes khas blangs nas sred pas bcings pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBondage‚Äù is called ‚Äúattachment to the self in the store consciousness‚Äù because one is bound by craving, having accepted the store consciousness as a self.

original: de ltar re zhig rnam grangs rnam par gzhag pa bstan to //üîΩyang rnam grangs bstan pa tsam gyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / rgyu nyid dang 'bras bu nyid gang yin pa de ni @130b nges par gzung bar mi nus pas de'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni gang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad kyi bag chags la brten nas de skyed pa'i nus pa'i khyad par can gyi rnam par
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rnam grangs rnam par gzhag pa bstan to // yang rnam grangs bstan pa tsam gyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / rgyu nyid dang 'bras bu nyid gang yin pa de ni @130b nges par gzung bar mi nus pas de'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni gang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad kyi bag chags la brten nas de skyed pa'i nus pa'i khyad par can gyi rnam par
translated: Thus, the above is the presentation of the synonyms.üîΩThe nature, cause, and result of the store consciousness, which is taught as a mere synonym, cannot be ascertained, so its own characteristic is that it is a consciousness that has a special ability to generate all dharmas of affliction on the basis of the propensities for them.

original: shes pa gang yin pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid dang / de nyid kyi nus pa ston pa ni sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes pa gang yin pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid dang / de nyid kyi nus pa ston pa ni sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The statement that it is the cause of the other evolving consciousnesses is the teaching of its cause. The statement that it is the result of the karmic forces is the teaching of its result. The statement that it is the support of all dharmas means that it is the support of the propensities for all dharmas.üîΩThe statement that it is the support of the dharmas of mind means that it is the support of the six consciousnesses.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams thams cad kyi bag chags la brten nas chos de rnams nyid skyes pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams thams cad kyi bag chags la brten nas chos de rnams nyid skyes pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The seeds are called ‚Äúthe possession of the seeds‚Äù because they are the cause for the production of those dharmas, based on the perfuming of all the dharmas of affliction.

original: nus pa'i bye brag goms pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nus pa'i bye brag goms pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that they are the special power of habit.

original: 'di dag ni de'i rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di dag ni de'i rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: These are the characteristics of the seeds.

original: des na rgyu nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi bag chags la brten nas de skyes pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi sa bon yongs su ldan pa ste /
analyzed: des na rgyu nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi bag chags la brten nas de skyes pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi sa bon yongs su ldan pa ste /
translated: The characteristic of cause is that the seeds are the cause for the production of those dharmas based on the perfuming of all the dharmas of affliction.üîΩThe cause of the store consciousness is the cause for the production of those dharmas that are perfumed by the dharmas of affliction and that are established as a special power.

original: rnam par shes pa gang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyis bsgo zhing nus pa khyad par can du kun tu bsgrubs pa gang de dag nyid skyed pa'i rgyu mtshan de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyis bsgo zhing nus pa khyad par can du kun tu bsgrubs pa gang de dag nyid skyed pa'i rgyu mtshan de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of result is that the store consciousness is the result of the dharmas of affliction.

original: de la 'bras bu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa nas brtsams nas /
translated: The characteristic of result is established beginning with the result of human effort.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus kyi bag chags la brten nas byung ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar la /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus kyi bag chags la brten nas byung ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar la /
translated: They arise in dependence on latent impressions from beginningless time.

original: chos de dag rnams kyi bag chags la brten nas mngon par grub pa'i thog ma med pa'i dus nas bag chags yongs su bzung bas chos de dag dang lhan cig skye ba dang / 'gag pa la brten nas gang skye ba'i rgyu mtshan 'di ni brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos de dag rnams kyi bag chags la brten nas mngon par grub pa'i thog ma med pa'i dus nas bag chags yongs su bzung bas chos de dag dang lhan cig skye ba dang / 'gag pa la brten nas gang skye ba'i rgyu mtshan 'di ni brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The latent impressions of those phenomena are fully grasped from beginningless time in dependence on their manifest establishment. In dependence on their co-arising and cessation, the reason for their arising should be stated.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de dag dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pa thob pa ni gang skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de dag dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pa thob pa ni gang skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The co-arising and cessation of those afflicted phenomena and the attainment of the reason for their arising are called the seeds of the afflicted phenomena.

original: chos de dag nyid kyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos de dag nyid kyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the cause of those phenomena themselves.

original: yang ci kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyi sa bon dag tha dad dam 'on te ma yin /
analyzed: yang ci kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyi sa bon dag tha dad dam 'on te ma yin /
translated: Moreover, is the foundation consciousness and the seeds of those afflicted phenomena different or not?

original: des cir 'gyur de dang tha dad na ni yan lag thams cad kyis kyang tha dad pa thob par 'gyur zhing kun gzhi rnam par shes pa skad cig mas kyang gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur de dang tha dad na ni yan lag thams cad kyis kyang tha dad pa thob par 'gyur zhing kun gzhi rnam par shes pa skad cig mas kyang gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were different from them, then all the parts would be different, and the foundation consciousness would be harmed by momentariness.

original: de dang tha dad pa'i phyir de la dge ba dang mi dge ba bdag gi bag chags yod pa sa bon nyid yin par 'gyur na de ni lung du ma bstan par 'dod do //
analyzed: de dang tha dad pa'i phyir de la dge ba dang mi dge ba bdag gi bag chags yod pa sa bon nyid yin par 'gyur na de ni lung du ma bstan par 'dod do //
translated: If it were different from them, then it would be the seed that is the latent impressions of virtue and nonvirtue, but it is asserted to be neutral.üîΩIf it were not different, then how could it be multiple?

original: tha mi dad na yang ji ltar na mang po yin des na de lta na yang ma yin te /üîΩgnyi ga ltar @131a * //
analyzed: tha mi dad na yang ji ltar na mang po yin des na de lta na yang ma yin te / gnyi ga ltar @131a * //
translated: Therefore it is not like that.

original: yang skyon yod do //
analyzed: yang skyon yod do //
translated: But if it is both, then there is a fault.

original: de la gnas pa de dag dang rdzas su ni tha dad pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: de la gnas pa de dag dang rdzas su ni tha dad pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: In that regard, it is not substantially different from those that abide in it.

original: sa bon thams cad pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar la de la tha dad pa yang ma yin tha mi dad pa yang ma yin zhes smos pa ni sngar smras pa'i skyon spangs pa'i don to //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar la de la tha dad pa yang ma yin tha mi dad pa yang ma yin zhes smos pa ni sngar smras pa'i skyon spangs pa'i don to //
translated: Up to the point of being called the seed of everything, in that regard, the statement it is not different and not not different is for the purpose of avoiding the previously mentioned faults.

original: de de bzhin du 'byung ba la zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de lta bur 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de de bzhin du 'byung ba la zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de lta bur 'byung ba'o //
translated: That is just so means that it occurs in that way.

original: de 'byung ba'i mthu'i khyad par can zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa ba'i chos de dag rnams skyed pa'i nus pa khyad par can gyis sbyor ba dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de 'byung ba'i mthu'i khyad par can zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa ba'i chos de dag rnams skyed pa'i nus pa khyad par can gyis sbyor ba dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The special power of its arising is that it is connected with the special ability to produce those dharmas of affliction.

original: de skyed pa'i nus pa dang / ldan pa yangs sa bon thams cad pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de skyed pa'i nus pa dang / ldan pa yangs sa bon thams cad pa zhes brjod do //
translated: That which possesses the ability to produce that is called the seed of all.

original: don 'di'i dpe ni ji ltar nas kyi sa bon la myu gu skyed pa'i rgyu nyid yod pas 'di ni de'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: don 'di'i dpe ni ji ltar nas kyi sa bon la myu gu skyed pa'i rgyu nyid yod pas 'di ni de'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: The example for this meaning is like the barley seed, which has the cause to produce the sprout, so it is its cause.

original: yang ji ltar dus ring por bzhag pa'am /
analyzed: yang ji ltar dus ring por bzhag pa'am /
translated: Moreover, how is it that it is placed for a long time?

original: me yis nyams pa'i nas kyi 'bras bu de ni nus pa nye bar bcom pa na de de lta bu'i rnam par gnas su zin kyang mthu nyams par gyur pas sa bon med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me yis nyams pa'i nas kyi 'bras bu de ni nus pa nye bar bcom pa na de de lta bu'i rnam par gnas su zin kyang mthu nyams par gyur pas sa bon med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, the barley fruit whose ability has been destroyed by fire, even though it remains in that state, its power is destroyed and it becomes as if it had no seed.

original: de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pas chos thams cad skyed pa'i nus pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pas chos thams cad skyed pa'i nus pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, the foundation consciousness is the cause of all dharmas because it has the power to produce all dharmas.

original: des na nus pa dang ldan pa las sa bon thams cad pa zhes brjod do //üîΩyang ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de dag dus mnyam du gcig gi rgyu nyid du gcig 'gyur bar ji ltar blta zhe na zhes bya ba ni dpes bstan te ji ltar mar me'i me lce byung ba dang snying po tshig pa phan tshun dus mnyam
analyzed: des na nus pa dang ldan pa las sa bon thams cad pa zhes brjod do // yang ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de dag dus mnyam du gcig gi rgyu nyid du gcig 'gyur bar ji ltar blta zhe na zhes bya ba ni dpes bstan te ji ltar mar me'i me lce byung ba dang snying po tshig pa phan tshun dus mnyam
translated: Therefore, it is called the seed of all seeds because it possesses the power.üîΩHow can we see that these afflicted dharmas are the cause of each other when they occur simultaneously? This is illustrated by an example.

original: pa skad cig ma gcig nyid la snying po gang la brten nas don der byung ba de ni de'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: pa skad cig ma gcig nyid la snying po gang la brten nas don der byung ba de ni de'i rgyu'o //
translated: Just as the flame of a lamp and the burning of the wick occur simultaneously in the same instant, the flame is the cause of the burning of the wick, because the burning of the wick occurs in dependence on the flame.

original: 'bar ba yang skad cig ma de nyid la brten nas bsregs pas de yang de'i sreg pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'bar ba yang skad cig ma de nyid la brten nas bsregs pas de yang de'i sreg pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The burning of the wick is the cause of the flame, because the flame is burned in dependence on the burning of the wick.

original: de ltar na lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yang bstan pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the simultaneous cause is also illustrated.

original: de bas na yod bzhin du yang rgyu dang 'bras bur grub par mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bas na yod bzhin du yang rgyu dang 'bras bur grub par mthong ngo //
translated: Therefore, even though they exist simultaneously, cause and effect are established.

original: ji ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas rgyu'i rkyen gzhan mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar 'dis ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams phan tshun gyi rgyu can nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: ji ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas rgyu'i rkyen gzhan mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar 'dis ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams phan tshun gyi rgyu can nyid du bstan te /
translated: From ‚ÄúThe so-called afflicted dharmas‚Äù up to ‚Äúbecause another causal condition is not perceived‚Äù shows that the store consciousness and the afflicted dharmas are the reciprocal causes of each other.

original: de ltar na rgyu'i rkyen yin no //üîΩbag chags tha dad pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu'i rkyen yin no // bag chags tha dad pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Thus, it is the causal condition.

original: sna tshogs ma yin pa de chos tha dad pa sna tshogs dag gi rgyur ji ltar rung zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sna tshogs ma yin pa de chos tha dad pa sna tshogs dag gi rgyur ji ltar rung zhes bya ba la /
translated: How can that nondifferentiated and nondiverse perfuming be the cause of those diverse differentiated dharmas?

original: ji ltar rung ba dpes bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rung ba dpes bstan par bya ste /
translated: How it can be so is shown by an example.

original: ji ltar gos @131b skud pa mang pos bcings na yang sna tshogs nyid du mi mthong la /
analyzed: ji ltar gos @131b skud pa mang pos bcings na yang sna tshogs nyid du mi mthong la /
translated: Just as when cloth is tied with many strings, it is not seen as diverse;

original: tshon gyi snod du bcug pa na sna tshogs su mthong ba ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gos kyi gnas lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshon gyi snod du bcug pa na sna tshogs su mthong ba ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gos kyi gnas lta bu'o //
translated: but when it is put into a dye bath, it is seen as diverse. The store consciousness is like the cloth.

original: 'bras bu mngon par grub pa'i tshon gyi snod ni 'bras bu mngon par grub pa'i tshon gyi snod de /
analyzed: 'bras bu mngon par grub pa'i tshon gyi snod ni 'bras bu mngon par grub pa'i tshon gyi snod de /
translated: The vessel of the color that is the manifest effect is the vessel of the color that is the manifest effect.

original: der bcug pa ni rkyen gyis yongs su gzung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩbag chags kyi dus na sna tshogs ma yin yang 'bras bu'i dus na rnam pa du ma'i chos kyi rgyu'i ngo bo mthong ste bcos pa'i gos bzhin no /
analyzed: der bcug pa ni rkyen gyis yongs su gzung ba zhes bya ba'i don to // bag chags kyi dus na sna tshogs ma yin yang 'bras bu'i dus na rnam pa du ma'i chos kyi rgyu'i ngo bo mthong ste bcos pa'i gos bzhin no /
translated: The insertion into that is the meaning of ‚Äúapprehended by conditions.‚Äù

original: // / bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: // / bam po gnyis pa /

analyzed: 'di ni theg pa chen po la phra ba mchog tu zab pa zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: de la phra ba ni so so'i skye bo'i blos rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mchog tu zab pa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa dag gis kyang rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de la mdor bsdu na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni 'di gnyis te /

analyzed: zhes bya ba las brtsams te /

analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa can dang / sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa rnam par 'byed pa can zhes bya ba 'di gnyis kyis ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ming bstan to //

analyzed: ngo bo nyid sna tshogs rnam par dbye ba'i rkyen gyi dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: bdag gi ngo bo'i bye brag rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rgyur gyur pa yin no //

original: 'di ni dmus long la glang po che'i dpes bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni dmus long la glang po che'i dpes bstan to //

original: ma rig pas dmus long zhes bya ba ni ma rig pas dmus long ste /

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo mi shes so //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo mi shes so //

analyzed: rgyu'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni rgyu nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //

original: 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /

original: de mi shes pa ste ma rig pa'i @132a * //
analyzed: de mi shes pa ste ma rig pa'i @132a * //
translated: Not knowing that, due to the power of ignorance,

analyzed: dbang gis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i dbye ba mi shes pas chos rnams kyi rgyu nyid du rang bzhin la sogs pa sems so //

analyzed: gnyis pa sdug pa dang mi sdug pa rnam par 'byed pa mi shes pas bdag nyid byed pa po dang / zab por shes so //

original: de la chos thams cad kyi rgyun ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de la chos thams cad kyi rgyun ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /

original: de la bag chags bsags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bag chags bsags pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'bras bu yang de nyid de nyid la bsgos pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad pa zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: 'gro ba de dang de'i ris mthun pa dang ris mi mthun pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa ni lus thams cad do //

analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa chos thams cad kyi sa bon bu bstan pa des bon gyi ngo bo nyid du kun tu gsal bar bya bar 'dod nas /

original: mi gsal ba ni phyi rol te /

analyzed: don gzhan yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'o //

analyzed: kun rdzob ces bya ba ni phyir rol te /

original: yang de dag ni skad cig pa ste /
analyzed: yang de dag ni skad cig pa ste /

analyzed: phyir rol gyi yang ji srid rtsa ba yod pa dang / ji srid @132b smin pa yod kyi bar du'o //

analyzed: g-yo ba la ni ma yin te /

analyzed: rlung bzhin no //

analyzed: rlung gis ni bsgo ba mi 'dzin te /

analyzed: bsgo bar 'os pa la sgo bar byed kyi bsgo bar bya ba ma yin pa 'di lta ste /

analyzed: 'khor ba ji srid pa'i bar du dge ba la sogs pa nges pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang yi g-yo ba 'du byed pa'i rkyen la ltos nas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'gro bar rnam par smin pa nyid yin

analyzed: gyi 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la ni chos mi mthun pa thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //

analyzed: gang yang de ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yon tan de dag dang ldan pas den bsgo @133a * // bar bya ba yin gyi /

original: drug po dag la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: drug po dag la ni ma yin te /
translated: The six consciousnesses are not,

analyzed: gang lhan cig 'byung ba dang 'gag pa yod na ni bag chags kyi gnas su 'gyur ro //

analyzed: rigs gzhan la yang thal bar 'gyur te /

original: mig la sogs pa rnams gzugs dang ba nyid du rigs mthun pas de dag kyang phan tshun bsgo bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams gzugs dang ba nyid du rigs mthun pas de dag kyang phan tshun bsgo bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because the eye, etc. are of a similar type in being clear form, and it follows that they are related to each other.

original: gang yang sngar bstan pa'i sa bon gnyis po phyi dang nang gi skyed pa dang ni 'phen par 'dod ces bya ba las /
analyzed: gang yang sngar bstan pa'i sa bon gnyis po phyi dang nang gi skyed pa dang ni 'phen par 'dod ces bya ba las /

analyzed: de la skyed par byed pa'i sa bon ni phyi rol gyi 'bras bu smin par 'gyur gyi bar du'o //

original: nang gi sa bon ni mthar thug pa'i bar du skyed par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: nang gi sa bon ni mthar thug pa'i bar du skyed par byed pa nyid do //

original: 'phen par byed pa ma btab pa ni phyi rol gyi'o //
analyzed: 'phen par byed pa ma btab pa ni phyi rol gyi'o //

original: shi ba ni nang gi ste /
analyzed: shi ba ni nang gi ste /

original: lus ni 'di phyis kyang mi 'gyes par 'phangs nas gnas so //
analyzed: lus ni 'di phyis kyang mi 'gyes par 'phangs nas gnas so //
translated: The body remains without being cast off, even after the death of the person.

original: gal te skye ba'i sa bon gyi rgyu can yin na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba'i sa bon gyi rgyu can yin na /

original: gang gis na de nyams par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gis na de nyams par mi 'gyur te /

original: dus phyis cung zad tsam yang rjes su 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus phyis cung zad tsam yang rjes su 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //

original: gal te skad cig ma gcig nas gcig tu 'jug par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te skad cig ma gcig nas gcig tu 'jug par 'gyur na /
translated: If it were to continue from one moment to the next,

analyzed: skad cig snga ma skad cig phyi ma'i rgyur gyur na ni des na nam yang nyams par mi 'gyur bas de bas na nges par 'phen pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //
translated: and if the previous moment were the cause of the subsequent moment, then it would never be destroyed. Therefore, it must arise from the cause of the projecting force.

original: sa bon de dag kyang mda' ltong sbyor ba dang 'dom rdzogs pa gnyis mda' 'gro ba dang phog pa gnyis kyi rgyur 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sa bon de dag kyang mda' ltong sbyor ba dang 'dom rdzogs pa gnyis mda' 'gro ba dang phog pa gnyis kyi rgyur 'gyur ba bzhin no //

original: yang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan gang yin pa de ni lus dang 'gro ba thams cad du nye bar spyod pa can du blta bar bya ba ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan gang yin pa de ni lus dang 'gro ba thams cad du nye bar spyod pa can du blta bar bya ba ste zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: 'di ltar de la nye bar spyod pa 'byung ba nyid ces bya ba'i don te /

analyzed: nye bar spyod pa'i ngo bo @133b nyi nye bar spyod pa can zhes byas nas so //

analyzed: don de nyid dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dang mngon pa'i lung gis bstan te /

analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ste / phan tshun rgyu'i dngos po dang zhes bya ba la rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa las de dag 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu'o // 'bras bu'i dngos por rtag tu sbyor //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la gang gi tshe kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rgyu yin pa na de'i tshe de 'bras bu yin la //

analyzed: rang gi dngos po la yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa gnyis 'byung ba ni med de /

analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang zhes bya ba ni des na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems nyid kyi rting la'o //

analyzed: bag chags de gnas dang bcas te zhes bya ba la / gnas dang bcas pa ste /

analyzed: bag chags de zhes bya ba ni nyon nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i bag chags so //
translated: The latent afflictive tendencies means the afflictions and the latent afflictions.

original: sa bon med pa las zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa las so //
analyzed: sa bon med pa las zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa las so //
translated: From the absence of seeds means from a lack of cause.

original: skye bar ni 'byung bar ro //
analyzed: skye bar ni 'byung bar ro //
translated: Arising means occurring.

original: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med par yang ngo //
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med par yang ngo //
translated: Would occur means would occur even without the storehouse consciousness.

original: de la nyon mongs pa nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid de /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid de /
translated: Affliction itself is the nature of affliction.

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: It is the affliction of affliction.

original: de ltar na 'dir nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, the affliction of affliction is not tenable here.

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gang gis mi rung ba de bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gang gis mi rung ba de bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: The affliction of karma should be established as untenable in terms of which mode.

original: ji ltar mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi rung zhe na /
translated: How is it untenable?üîΩBecause the condition of volitions for consciousness is untenable.

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa mi rung ba'i phyir zhes pa ni bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed 'byung ba dang / 'gag pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa @135a * //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa mi rung ba'i phyir zhes pa ni bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed 'byung ba dang / 'gag pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa @135a * //
translated: The arising and cessation of meritorious, non-meritorious, and unshakable volitions, without the all-base consciousness,

original: med na gang la bag chags 'jog par 'gyur /
analyzed: med na gang la bag chags 'jog par 'gyur /
translated: where would the latent tendencies be deposited?

original: ji ltar na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gis bag chags mi 'dzin pa ni sngar nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bstan par bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gis bag chags mi 'dzin pa ni sngar nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bstan par bsgrubs zin to //
translated: How the six collections of consciousness do not retain latent tendencies has already been established in the explanation of the affliction of affliction.

original: de med na zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa med na'o //
analyzed: de med na zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa med na'o //
translated: If there were no such consciousness, then consciousness conditioned by karmic formations would not exist.

original: len pa'i rkyen gyis sred pa yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: len pa'i rkyen gyis sred pa yang mi rung ste /
translated: Craving conditioned by clinging would not be tenable.

original: gang gi phyir 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa len pa'i dbang gis bag chags rgyas pas srid pa 'byung bas so //üîΩde la las nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa len pa'i dbang gis bag chags rgyas pas srid pa 'byung bas so // de la las nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: Because existence would arise from the development of the latent impressions of consciousness infused by karmic formations through the power of clinging.

original: las las kun nas nyon mongs pa ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /üîΩkun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na /
analyzed: las las kun nas nyon mongs pa ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ste / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na /
translated: Here, the affliction of karma is either the affliction of karma or the affliction from karma.

original: de yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de yang mi rung ngo //
translated: If there were no storehouse consciousness, then that would not be tenable.

original: de'i tshe kun nas nyon mongs pa yang ji ltar mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe kun nas nyon mongs pa yang ji ltar mi rung zhe na /
translated: How could affliction not be tenable at that time?

original: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba sprel ba mi rung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba sprel ba mi rung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: because the connection of rebirth would not be tenable.

original: bdag gi dngos po 'thob pa yang mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po 'thob pa yang mi rigs pa'o //
translated: The attainment of the status of self would not be tenable.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa nas zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams nas so //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa nas zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams nas so //
translated: From the non-concentrated stage means from the realm of desire.

original: shi 'phos pa'i zhes bya ba ni shi ba'o //
analyzed: shi 'phos pa'i zhes bya ba ni shi ba'o //
translated: Death means death.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa can gyis zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa can gyis zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The defiled mental consciousness means the mental consciousness that is associated with the afflictions.

original: nyid mtshams sbyor zhing sprel te zhes bya ba ni bdag gi dngos po yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor zhing sprel te zhes bya ba ni bdag gi dngos po yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is reborn and linked means it takes up the status of self.

original: de yang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i srid pa la dmigs nas bar mdo'i srid pa 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i srid pa la dmigs nas bar mdo'i srid pa 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, the defiled mental consciousness, having taken the existence at birth as its object, causes the existence in the intermediate state to cease.

original: brgyal ba de la zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa khu ba dang khrag dang lhan cig grub pa dang / bde ba gcig par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: brgyal ba de la zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa khu ba dang khrag dang lhan cig grub pa dang / bde ba gcig par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: In that state of unconsciousness means in the mental consciousness that is established together with semen and blood, and that is one with pleasure.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa brgyal bar gyur pa de la brten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa gzhan nyid 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa brgyal bar gyur pa de la brten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa gzhan nyid 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: In dependence on that mental consciousness that has become unconscious, another mental consciousness enters.

original: lhan cig tu zhes bya ba ni dus gcig tu yid kyi rnam par shes pa brgyal bar gyur pa de dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig tu zhes bya ba ni dus gcig tu yid kyi rnam par shes pa brgyal bar gyur pa de dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTogether‚Äù means that the mind consciousness is suspended at the same time as the mental faculty.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dus rtag tu nyon mongs pa can gnas yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dus rtag tu nyon mongs pa can gnas yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the afflicted mind is the basis for the afflicted mind consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi gnas te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi gnas te /
translated: The afflicted mind consciousness is the basis for the afflicted mind that is associated with attachment and the other mental afflictions.

original: 'byung ba'i srid pa la dmigs pa yid nyon mongs pa can 'di'i gnas yin pas 'di ni nyon mongs pa can gyi gnas so //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i srid pa la dmigs pa yid nyon mongs pa can 'di'i gnas yin pas 'di ni nyon mongs pa can gyi gnas so //
translated: The afflicted mind is the basis for the afflicted mind consciousness that focuses on the existence of the elements that constitute the body and that is the cause of the arising of the mind consciousness.

original: rnam par smin pa lung du ma @135b bstan pa'i gnas skabs de na nyon mongs pa can gyis gnas ni mi srid do //üîΩyid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa la mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa la nye bar gnas te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa lung du ma @135b bstan pa'i gnas skabs de na nyon mongs pa can gyis gnas ni mi srid do // yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa la mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa la nye bar gnas te /
translated: The afflicted mind is not the basis for the mind consciousness when it is in a neutral state that is not associated with any mental afflictions.üîΩ‚ÄúThe object of the mind consciousness is not present‚Äù means that the mind consciousness is not present in relation to its object.

original: 'di lta ste chos so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste chos so //
translated: The object of the mind consciousness is the mental factors.

original: brgyal bar gyur pa de la ni dmigs pa med de /
analyzed: brgyal bar gyur pa de la ni dmigs pa med de /
translated: But that which is unconscious does not have an object.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not suitable to be mental consciousness.

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba sprel zin pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi lus rab tu thob pa'o //
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba sprel zin pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi lus rab tu thob pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving already taken up the connection‚Äù means having obtained one‚Äôs own body.

original: de nas gzhan zhes byung ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma yin pa ni gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: de nas gzhan zhes byung ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma yin pa ni gzhan pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthen another‚Äù means that the other, which is not the store consciousness,

original: gzhan rnam par shes pa drug po rnams ni gnas so sor nges pa dang g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan rnam par shes pa drug po rnams ni gnas so sor nges pa dang g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: is the six consciousnesses, because they are fixed in their own locations and move.

original: ji ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa gnas so sor nges pa yin pa bzhin du rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyi yang rna ba la sogs pa dbang po gzugs can rnams ni rten yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa gnas so sor nges pa yin pa bzhin du rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyi yang rna ba la sogs pa dbang po gzugs can rnams ni rten yin no //
translated: Just as visual consciousness is fixed in its own location, the remaining ones, such as auditory consciousness, are also fixed in their own locations, because their supports are the physical sense organs, such as the ears.

original: des na gal te rnam par shes pa de dag gi rang rang gi gnas blangs par gyur la /
analyzed: des na gal te rnam par shes pa de dag gi rang rang gi gnas blangs par gyur la /
translated: Therefore, if those consciousnesses were to take up their own locations,

original: rnam par shes pa de rnams 'gags par gyur pa na thob pa'i mig la sogs pa rnams rul par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de rnams 'gags par gyur pa na thob pa'i mig la sogs pa rnams rul par 'gyur ro //
translated: When those consciousnesses cease, the obtained eye, etc. will decay.

original: ji ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'i rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs mdung khyim ltar gcig la gcig brten pa'i tshul gyis 'jug pa gang yin pa de yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'i rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs mdung khyim ltar gcig la gcig brten pa'i tshul gyis 'jug pa gang yin pa de yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also, it is not tenable that name-and-form and consciousness, which are not foundation consciousness, engage in the manner of mutual support like a bundle of reeds.

original: ji ltar mi rung ba bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar mi rung ba bstan par bya ste /
translated: How is it not tenable?

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /üîΩming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis kyang rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs / ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis kyang rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs pa de la /
translated: It is as the BhagavƒÅn said: ‚ÄúConditioned by consciousness is name-and-form.üîΩConditioned by name-and-form is also consciousness.‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming ste /
translated: Here, conditioned by consciousness is name.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs so //
translated: It is the collection of consciousnesses.

original: de ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi yin par brjod do //
analyzed: de ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi yin par brjod do //
translated: It is said to be the four aggregates that are not form.

original: gzugs ni nur nur po'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni nur nur po'o //
translated: Form is the kalala.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba de la /
translated: The condition of name-and-form is consciousness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzhan gang yang ma yin te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzhan gang yang ma yin te /
translated: This is not anything other than the store consciousness.

original: gang de ni ming dang gzugs la brten nas skad cig ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i rgyan mi 'chad par 'jug go //
analyzed: gang de ni ming dang gzugs la brten nas skad cig ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i rgyan mi 'chad par 'jug go //
translated: It is that which, based on name-and-form, evolves in an unbroken stream from the initial to the final moment.

original: rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi zas su mi rung ste zhes bya ba de bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi zas su mi rung ste zhes bya ba de bstan par bya ste /
translated: It is not suitable as food for any other consciousness.

original: zas ni bzhir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: zas ni bzhir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One taught that food is of four kinds:

original: khams kyi zas dang / reg pa dang / yid la sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i'o //üîΩde la kham gyi zas ni zhu bar gyur pa na ste /
analyzed: khams kyi zas dang / reg pa dang / yid la sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i'o // de la kham gyi zas ni zhu bar gyur pa na ste /
translated: food by way of morsel, food by way of contact, food by way of mental volitions, and food by way of consciousness.üîΩOf these, food by way of morsel is that which, when it is digested,

original: zhu bar gyur pa na gang gi @136a * //
analyzed: zhu bar gyur pa na gang gi @136a * //
translated: is digested in such a way that

original: phyir rten la phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: phyir rten la phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
translated: it benefits the body.

original: reg pa'i zas ni yul dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: reg pa'i zas ni yul dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Food by way of contact is that which benefits the body by the mere experience of an object.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams mthong ba tsam nyid kyis rten la phan 'dogs pa skyed pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams mthong ba tsam nyid kyis rten la phan 'dogs pa skyed pa'o //
translated: It is that which generates benefit for the body by the mere experience of objects such as form.

original: yid la sems pa'i zas ni bsam pa dang ldan pa na ste /
analyzed: yid la sems pa'i zas ni bsam pa dang ldan pa na ste /
translated: The food of mental volition is for those who have intention.

original: gang gi phyir bsam pas rten la phan 'dogs pa 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsam pas rten la phan 'dogs pa 'byung ba ste /
translated: Because when there is intention, there is benefit for the basis.

original: skom pas gdungs pa chu mthong bas ma shi ba bzhin no //
analyzed: skom pas gdungs pa chu mthong bas ma shi ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, a thirsty person sees water and does not die.

original: rnam par shes pa'i zas ni nye bar len pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i zas ni nye bar len pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The food of consciousness is for those who have appropriation.

original: gang gis de blangs pa nyid kyis rten gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis de blangs pa nyid kyis rten gnas pa ste /
translated: Because when there is appropriation, the basis remains.

original: de las gzhan du na shi ba'i ro bzhin du rul par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan du na shi ba'i ro bzhin du rul par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, like a dead body, it would decay.

original: de lta bas na rten la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i zas nyid ni khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na rten la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i zas nyid ni khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because it benefits the basis, the food of consciousness should be accepted.

original: de la reg pa'i zas ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gang yin pa'i'o //
analyzed: de la reg pa'i zas ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gang yin pa'i'o //
translated: Among them, the food of contact is for those who have the six collections of consciousness.

original: yid la sems pa'i zas ni yid kyis bsams pa'i'o //
analyzed: yid la sems pa'i zas ni yid kyis bsams pa'i'o //
translated: The food of mental volition is for those who have intention.

original: gzhan pa rnam par shes pa'i zas nyid du bstan pa gang yin pa ni sems med pa'i gnyid dang / brgyal ba dang / 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa na rnam par shes pa drug ni 'gag par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan pa rnam par shes pa'i zas nyid du bstan pa gang yin pa ni sems med pa'i gnyid dang / brgyal ba dang / 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa na rnam par shes pa drug ni 'gag par 'gyur na /
translated: The food of consciousness is taught to be the cause of the other foods. When one is unconscious, such as in sleep, fainting, or the attainment of cessation, the six consciousnesses cease.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na lus blangs pa mi 'drul par byed pa gzhan gang yin /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na lus blangs pa mi 'drul par byed pa gzhan gang yin /
translated: If there were no foundation consciousness, what other factor would prevent the body from decaying?

original: de ltar mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i 'brel pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i 'brel pa bstan to //
translated: Thus the connection of the foundation consciousness with the nonconcentrated state has been taught.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i yang ji ltar mi rung ba de bstan par bya ste ;üîΩ'di ni nyon mongs pa can gyi rnam par shes pas nyid mtshams sbyor zhing sprel te /
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i yang ji ltar mi rung ba de bstan par bya ste ; 'di ni nyon mongs pa can gyi rnam par shes pas nyid mtshams sbyor zhing sprel te /
translated: Now the question is raised as to how it is connected with the concentrated state.üîΩThe answer is that the foundation consciousness connects with and is related to the defiled mind.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa la nyon mongs pa can dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pas nying mtshams sbyor zhing sprel to //
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa la nyon mongs pa can dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pas nying mtshams sbyor zhing sprel to //
translated: The defiled mind connects with and is related to the foundation consciousness in the concentrated state.

original: nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba ni de'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa can te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba ni de'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa can te /
translated: The term defiled means that the defiled mind is defiled by the passions of that stage.

original: de'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi ro myang ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi ro myang ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The affliction of that realm is the relishing of the taste of samƒÅdhi.

original: de'i nyon mongs pa can gyi sems ni mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa nyid kyi dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems so //
analyzed: de'i nyon mongs pa can gyi sems ni mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa nyid kyi dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems so //
translated: The afflicted mind of that realm is the mind of the stage of equipoise and the mind of the stage of nonequipoise.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa 'di nas shi 'phos pa na shi 'phos pa'i sems gang yin pa de de'i sa pa dang phrad par gang gis ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa 'di nas shi 'phos pa na shi 'phos pa'i sems gang yin pa de de'i sa pa dang phrad par gang gis ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: When one dies and transmigrates from this stage of nonequipoise, how could the mind of death, which is of that stage, be connected to the mind of birth?

original: des na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nges par khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: des na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nges par khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the foundation consciousness must definitely be accepted.

original: gang la thog ma med pa nas sa de'i sems kyi bag chags yod de /
analyzed: gang la thog ma med pa nas sa de'i sems kyi bag chags yod de /
translated: Since beginningless time, the predispositions of the mind of that realm exist in it.

original: bag chags gang las sems de kun tu rgyu ba des nyid mtshams sbyor zhing sprel to //
analyzed: bag chags gang las sems de kun tu rgyu ba des nyid mtshams sbyor zhing sprel to //
translated: From those predispositions, the mind of that realm is connected and linked.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBorn in the formless realm‚Äù means

original: gzugs @136b las grol ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs @136b las grol ba'o //
translated: liberated from form.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang dge ba'i sems zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi ro myang ba nyid do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang dge ba'i sems zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi ro myang ba nyid do //
translated: The so-called defiled mind and good mind are the experience of the taste of samƒÅdhi.

original: sa bon med cing gzhi med pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa nyid dang rkyen med pa nyid do //
analyzed: sa bon med cing gzhi med pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa nyid dang rkyen med pa nyid do //
translated: The so-called seedless and groundless are the absence of cause and the absence of conditions.

original: don gzhan yang rgyu med pa'i phyir gang las 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: don gzhan yang rgyu med pa'i phyir gang las 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, because there is no cause, from what would it arise?

original: gzhi med na gang la brten te 'jug par 'gyur na sems de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rnam par shes pas yongs su gzung ba'i rang gi sa bon las 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhi med na gang la brten te 'jug par 'gyur na sems de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rnam par shes pas yongs su gzung ba'i rang gi sa bon las 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If there is no ground, on what would it depend and engage? That mind arises from its own seed, which is the consciousness that apprehends the store consciousness.

original: de la brten nas de nyid kyi rgyun rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la brten nas de nyid kyi rgyun rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: In dependence on that, its continuum continues to engage.

original: de nyid na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems mngon du byed pa'i ste /
