analyzed: de nyid na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems mngon du byed pa'i ste /
translated: That very [mind] manifests the supramundane mind.

original: de ma yin pa gzhan 'jig rten pa'i sems med par 'gyur pas de'i 'gro ba ldog pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'bad pa med par phung po lhag ma med par mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de ma yin pa gzhan 'jig rten pa'i sems med par 'gyur pas de'i 'gro ba ldog pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'bad pa med par phung po lhag ma med par mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Since there would be no other worldly mind, the continuum of its reincarnating being would be stopped.

original: de yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na ma yin pas de ltar yang mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na ma yin pas de ltar yang mi 'grub bo //
translated: But that is not established, since without the foundation consciousness, one would attain nirvana without remainder without effort.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du skyes pa rnams kyang ci yang med pa'i skye mched pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems mngon du byed pa na /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du skyes pa rnams kyang ci yang med pa'i skye mched pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems mngon du byed pa na /
translated: Also, when those born in the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment manifest the transcendent mind of the base of nothingness,

original: gang gi phyir sems de ni gsal por 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems de ni gsal por 'jug pa yin la /
translated: that mind would be clear,

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi ni mi gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi ni mi gsal ba yin no //
translated: but the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment is unclear.

original: des na gsal bar 'jug pa'i sems la gnas nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems mngon du byed de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems gcig pu de'i gzhir 'gro ba gnyis mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na gsal bar 'jug pa'i sems la gnas nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems mngon du byed de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems gcig pu de'i gzhir 'gro ba gnyis mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, having remained in a mind that engages with clarity, one manifests a supramundane mind. It is not tenable that that single supramundane mind is the basis of both reincarnating beings.

original: 'jig rten pa'i sa de dag ni sa gzhan du skyes pa'i sa gzhan pa'i sems mngon du byed pa 'gro ba gnyi ga'i rten du mi rigs la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i sa de dag ni sa gzhan du skyes pa'i sa gzhan pa'i sems mngon du byed pa 'gro ba gnyi ga'i rten du mi rigs la /
translated: It is not tenable that those mundane levels are the basis of both reincarnating beings, manifesting a mind of another level due to being born on another level.

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i gzhir yang sems de ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i gzhir yang sems de ni mi rung ngo //
translated: It is also not tenable that that mind is the basis of nirvƒÅ·πáa that possesses the remainder of the aggregates.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba gsum po de dag kyang gzhi'i ngo bor mi rigs pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na sems de gang la brten par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba gsum po de dag kyang gzhi'i ngo bor mi rigs pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na sems de gang la brten par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, since it is not tenable that those three reincarnating beings are the essence of the basis, if there is no foundation consciousness, what is the basis of that mind?

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems de legs par bya ba byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems de legs par bya ba byed pa'am /
translated: That supramundane mind is either a mind that performs good actions

original: nyes par bya ba byed pa 'chi 'pho ba na lus smad dam stod nas drod yal bar 'gyur ba'ang mi rung ste zhes bya ba la de legs par bya ba byed pa dang / nyes par bya ba byed pa'i lus kyi smad dang stod nas drod yal bar 'gyur te /üîΩ'di ltar legs par bya ba byed pa ni smad nas so //üîΩnyes par bya ba byed pa ni stod nas so //
analyzed: nyes par bya ba byed pa 'chi 'pho ba na lus smad dam stod nas drod yal bar 'gyur ba'ang mi rung ste zhes bya ba la de legs par bya ba byed pa dang / nyes par bya ba byed pa'i lus kyi smad dang stod nas drod yal bar 'gyur te / 'di ltar legs par bya ba byed pa ni smad nas so // nyes par bya ba byed pa ni stod nas so //
translated: The heat of the body of one who has done good leaves from the lower part,

original: de nas de dag kyang kun gzhi rnam @137a * //
analyzed: de nas de dag kyang kun gzhi rnam @137a * //
translated: and the heat of the body of one who has done evil leaves from the upper part.

original: par shes pas yongs su gzung bar mi 'dod na /
analyzed: par shes pas yongs su gzung bar mi 'dod na /
translated: If you do not accept that the body is held by the store consciousness,

original: lus drod yal bar 'gyur ba de ji ltar yin /üîΩkun gzhi rnam par shes pa des gzung bas ni lus 'dor bar byed pa na smad dam stod nas ji ltar rigs pas drod yal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus drod yal bar 'gyur ba de ji ltar yin / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa des gzung bas ni lus 'dor bar byed pa na smad dam stod nas ji ltar rigs pas drod yal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: how is it that the heat of the body leaves?üîΩWhen one who has done good leaves the body, the heat leaves from the lower part, and when one who has done evil leaves the body, the heat leaves from the upper part.

original: 'dor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This is because the heat of the body is held by the store consciousness.

original: ji ltar na 'jig rten pa'i rnam par byang ba yang mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'jig rten pa'i rnam par byang ba yang mi rung zhe na /
translated: How is it unreasonable that the purification of the world is not possible?

original: de bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de bstan par bya ste /
translated: This will be explained.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to become free from attachment to the desire realm,üîΩwhen one applies oneself to the path of cultivation, the desire realm mind that arises from the path of cultivation does not arise with the form realm mind, nor does it arise simultaneously with it, nor does it arise after it.

original: rab tu sbyor ba na 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i sems de yang gzugs na spyod pa'i sems dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir des bsgos pa med pa gzugs na spyod pa'i sems de sa bon med par skye ba
analyzed: rab tu sbyor ba na 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i sems de yang gzugs na spyod pa'i sems dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir des bsgos pa med pa gzugs na spyod pa'i sems de sa bon med par skye ba
translated: Therefore, the form realm mind is not moistened by it.

original: nyid yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyid yin par 'gyur te /
translated: The form realm mind arises without a seed.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i sems 'das pa tshe rabs du mar sems gzhan gyis bar du bcad pa de yang 'das pa'i phyir med pa nyid de /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i sems 'das pa tshe rabs du mar sems gzhan gyis bar du bcad pa de yang 'das pa'i phyir med pa nyid de /
translated: The past form realm mind, interrupted by other minds over many lifetimes, is also nonexistent because it is past.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems de'i sa bon nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems de'i sa bon nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable to be the seed of the present equipoise mind.

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The cause of that and the condition of that means

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i rang gi sa bon las byung ba'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i rang gi sa bon las byung ba'o //
translated: arising from its own seed that is located in the foundation consciousness.

original: sbyor ba las byung ba'i dge ba'i sems de ni nus pa med pa ma yin pas bdag po'i rkyen ni de'i nus pa yin pas rgyu'i rkyen nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba'i dge ba'i sems de ni nus pa med pa ma yin pas bdag po'i rkyen ni de'i nus pa yin pas rgyu'i rkyen nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Since that virtuous mind derived from preparation is not without capability, its dominant condition is its capability, and it is not a causal condition.

original: de bas na bdag po'i rkyen las 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na bdag po'i rkyen las 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems de 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, that desire realm mind arises from a dominant condition.

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar ro //
translated: Similarly, apply this to those who are free from attachment and so on.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par byang ba mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par byang ba mi rung zhe na /
translated: How is it that supramundane purification is impossible?

original: de bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de bstan par bya ste /
translated: That should be explained.

original: de ni gzhan gyi sgra la brten pa dang / so so rang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni /üîΩsgra dang mtshungs par ldan pa'am /
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi sgra la brten pa dang / so so rang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni / sgra dang mtshungs par ldan pa'am /
translated: It is said that it is dependent on the words of another and proper mental attention.

original: yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa'o //
translated: It is concomitant with sound or mental attention.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam par g-yeng bas bar du chod la zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems rnam par nyams pa zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam par g-yeng bas bar du chod la zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems rnam par nyams pa zhes bya ba'i don
translated: And when the mental consciousness is interrupted by other consciousnesses that are distracted, it is said that the supramundane mind that is concomitant with correct view degenerates.

original: to // gang gi tshe tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang mtshungs pa'i sems byung ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: to // gang gi tshe tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang mtshungs pa'i sems byung ba de'i tshe /
translated: When the mind that is concomitant with proper mental attention arises,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa thob pa'i bag chags bsgos pa des ni bag chags dang bcas te 'gags shing 'das nas yun ring du lon te zhes bya ba la yid kyi rnam par shes pa thos pas bsgos pa de bag chags dang bcas par dus ring du
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa thob pa'i bag chags bsgos pa des ni bag chags dang bcas te 'gags shing 'das nas yun ring du lon te zhes bya ba la yid kyi rnam par shes pa thos pas bsgos pa de bag chags dang bcas par dus ring du
translated: the mental consciousness that is infused with the imprints of hearing is infused with those imprints and ceases and passes away.

original: shin tu 'gags shing shin tu 'das pas yod pa ma yin na phyis de'i rgyu can dag yang gang @137b las 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: shin tu 'gags shing shin tu 'das pas yod pa ma yin na phyis de'i rgyu can dag yang gang @137b las 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Since it has long passed away and is not present, how can the later imprints arise from it?

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems de la thos pa'i bag chags kyis ni de'i sa bon yongs su 'dzin par mi rigs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems de la thos pa'i bag chags kyis ni de'i sa bon yongs su 'dzin par mi rigs zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not reasonable that the mind associated with proper mental attention should hold the seeds of that mind, because of the imprint of hearing.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the mundane mental consciousness.

original: thos pa'i bag chags zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sgra la brten nas thos pa'i bag chags yid kyi rnam par shes pas brtags pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa'i bag chags zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sgra la brten nas thos pa'i bag chags yid kyi rnam par shes pas brtags pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúimprint of hearing‚Äù is the imprint of hearing that is imagined by the mental consciousness in dependence on the words of another.

original: de'i sa bon yongs su 'dzin par mi rigs zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par byang ba'i sa bon yongs su 'dzin par mi rigs pa des na de de las skye bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i sa bon yongs su 'dzin par mi rigs zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par byang ba'i sa bon yongs su 'dzin par mi rigs pa des na de de las skye bar mi rung ngo //
translated: ‚Äú It is not reasonable that it should hold the seeds of that‚Äù means that it is not reasonable that it should hold the seeds of supramundane purification. Therefore, it is not possible for that to arise from it.

original: yang ji ltar sa bon thams cad smin pa'i rnam par shes pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar sa bon thams cad smin pa'i rnam par shes pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin na /
translated: Moreover, if the consciousness in which all the seeds have matured is the cause of affliction,

original: de'i gnyen po 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems kyi sa bon du ji ltar rung zhes bya ba la rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa de nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rgyur gyur pa yin na gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rgyu nyid du yang mi rung ngo
analyzed: de'i gnyen po 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems kyi sa bon du ji ltar rung zhes bya ba la rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa de nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rgyur gyur pa yin na gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rgyu nyid du yang mi rung ngo
translated: If that consciousness were the cause of the adverse class, it could not be the cause of the class of antidotes.

original: / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems ni ma 'dres pa ste zhes bya ba dang / de ni sngar ma skyes pas de'i gang de'i bag chags ni med pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems ni ma 'dres pa ste zhes bya ba dang / de ni sngar ma skyes pas de'i gang de'i bag chags ni med pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The supramundane mind is unmixed, and since it has not arisen previously, it has no habitual propensities.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems de'i bag chags ni med pa nyid du the tshom med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems de'i bag chags ni med pa nyid du the tshom med do //
translated: There is no doubt that the supramundane mind has no habitual propensities.üîΩIt arises from the seed of the habitual propensities of hearing, which is the natural outflow of the extremely pure dharmadhatu.

original: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mthun pa thos pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon las de 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la nyan thos la sogs pa las bye brag tu byas pa ni //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mthun pa thos pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon las de 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la nyan thos la sogs pa las bye brag tu byas pa ni //
translated: The distinction between the sriivaka and so on is as follows.

original: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mthun pa thos pa'i bag chags so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mthun pa thos pa'i bag chags so //
translated: The habitual propensities of hearing are the natural outcome of the extremely pure realm of the Dharma.

original: gang gi phyir chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rab tu spang pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rab tu spang pa'o //
translated: The extremely pure realm of the Dharma is the complete abandonment of the obscurations of the afflictions and the knowable.

original: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par ngag pa gang yin pa de'i rgyu mthun pa ni bstan pa'i chos te mdo sde la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par ngag pa gang yin pa de'i rgyu mthun pa ni bstan pa'i chos te mdo sde la sogs pa'o //
translated: The natural outcome of the extremely pure realm of the Dharma is the Dharma that is taught, which is the sutras and so forth.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa mdos de la sogs pa thos pa ni chos kyi dbyings rgyu mthun pa thos pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa mdos de la sogs pa thos pa ni chos kyi dbyings rgyu mthun pa thos pa'o //
translated: Hearing the Dharma that is the natural outcome of the realm of the Dharma is hearing the sutras and so forth.

original: de thos pa'i bag chags ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa thos pa'i bag chags so //
analyzed: de thos pa'i bag chags ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa thos pa'i bag chags so //
translated: The habitual propensities of that hearing are the habitual propensities of hearing the natural outcome of the realm of the Dharma.

original: yang na thos pa nyid kyi bag chags ni thos pa'i bag chags te /
analyzed: yang na thos pa nyid kyi bag chags ni thos pa'i bag chags te /
translated: Alternatively, the habitual propensities of hearing are the habitual propensities of hearing.

original: de'i bag chags gang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa de'i rgyu can de las 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems 'byung bar 'gyur ro //üîΩthos pa'i bag chags gang yin pa de ltar kun @138a * //
analyzed: de'i bag chags gang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa de'i rgyu can de las 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems 'byung bar 'gyur ro // thos pa'i bag chags gang yin pa de ltar kun @138a * //
translated: The latent impressions of that are located in the storehouse consciousness. The supramundane mind arises from that which has it as its cause.

original: gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin nam /
analyzed: gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin nam /
translated: Is the latent impression of hearing the nature of the storehouse consciousness?

original: 'on te ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin te /
translated: Or is it not?

original: de cir 'gyur /
analyzed: de cir 'gyur /
translated: What follows from that?

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no /
translated: It is the nature of the storehouse consciousness.

original: de ji ltar kun gzhi ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de'i gnyen po'i sa bon nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar kun gzhi ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de'i gnyen po'i sa bon nyid du 'gyur /
translated: How can it be the seed of the antidote to that storehouse consciousness, like the storehouse consciousness itself?

original: 'on te de'i ngo bo ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te de'i ngo bo ma yin no //
translated: Or, if it is not its nature,

original: thos pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon de'i gzhi gzhan yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thos pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon de'i gzhi gzhan yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: the seed of the latent impression of hearing would have a different basis.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub la brten nas thos pa'i bag chags 'jug par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mthun pa thos pa'i bag chags de nyid do brten nas zhes bya ba ni gang gi rgud las 'jug pa
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub la brten nas thos pa'i bag chags 'jug par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mthun pa thos pa'i bag chags de nyid do brten nas zhes bya ba ni gang gi rgud las 'jug pa
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin dependence‚Äù means that they are infused in dependence on the buddhas.

original: ste / de yang lhan cig 'dug pa'i tshul gyis chu dang 'o ma bzhin du ngo bo gcig par 'jug par 'gyur na yang de de'i ngo bo ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: ste / de yang lhan cig 'dug pa'i tshul gyis chu dang 'o ma bzhin du ngo bo gcig par 'jug par 'gyur na yang de de'i ngo bo ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: Moreover, although they are infused in the same way that water and milk mix, they are not of the same nature as the buddhas.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not the foundation consciousness.

original: de'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are the antidote to the foundation consciousness.

original: de la chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i thos pa las byung ba dang / bsam pa las byung ba dang ; bsgoms pa las byung ba yang blta bar bya ba yin pas re re zhing rnam pa gsum pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i thos pa las byung ba dang / bsam pa las byung ba dang ; bsgoms pa las byung ba yang blta bar bya ba yin pas re re zhing rnam pa gsum pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In this regard, the small, medium, and great forms of hearing, reflection, and meditation are to be seen as threefold, since each is of three types.

original: don gzhan yang thos pa las byung ba ni chung ngu'o //
analyzed: don gzhan yang thos pa las byung ba ni chung ngu'o //
translated: Moreover, the small is that which arises from hearing.

original: bsams pa las byung ba ni 'bring ngo //
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba ni 'bring ngo //
translated: The medium is that which arises from reflection.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba ni chen po'o //
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba ni chen po'o //
translated: The great is that which arises from cultivation.

original: thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa lan mang du bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thos pa la sogs pa lhag par byed pa ste /
analyzed: thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa lan mang du bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thos pa la sogs pa lhag par byed pa ste /
translated: The small, medium, and great are due to the predominance of hearing, etc.

original: de yang chung dun gyi rgyu las 'bring dang / 'bring las chen po'o //
analyzed: de yang chung dun gyi rgyu las 'bring dang / 'bring las chen po'o //
translated: The small is the cause of the medium, and the medium is the cause of the great.

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa'i gnyen po zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa lhag par 'jug pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa'i gnyen po zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa lhag par 'jug pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: The antidote to the defilement entanglements is the antidote to the predominance of passion, etc.

original: gang gis de spong ba de ni ngan 'gro'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de spong ba de ni ngan 'gro'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: That by which one abandons them is the antidote to the miserable realms.üîΩThe miserable realms are the hells, hungry ghosts, and animals.

original: gang la rnam grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las gang gis ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ba de yang /üîΩnges par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gang la rnam grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las gang gis ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ba de yang /üîΩnges par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The antidote to the miserable realms is the antidote to the karma that would otherwise be experienced in the miserable realms.üîΩThe antidote to the miserable realms is the antidote to the karma that would otherwise be experienced in the miserable realms.

original: mdor bsdu na 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i nyes par spyod pa thams cad kyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i nyes par spyod pa thams cad kyi gnyen po'o //
translated: In brief, it is the antidote to all the misdeeds of the past, future, and present.

original: ma 'ongs pa na dge ba'i bshes gnyen dad pa dang / phrad pa thob pa'i rgyu nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na dge ba'i bshes gnyen dad pa dang / phrad pa thob pa'i rgyu nyid kyang yin no //
translated: It is also the cause for obtaining faith and meeting with the spiritual teacher in the future.

original: byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa rnams kyi 'jig rten pa yin yang chos kyi skur bsdus pa yin par blta bar bya zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa rnams kyi 'jig rten pa yin yang chos kyi skur bsdus pa yin par blta bar bya zhes bya ba la /
translated: The worldly virtues of the beginner bodhisattvas should be seen as included in the Dharma Body.

original: las dang po bzhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams so //
analyzed: las dang po bzhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams so //
translated: The beginner bodhisattvas are the ordinary persons.

original: chos kyi skur bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi skur bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: They are included in the Dharma Body, because they are the cause of it.

original: rnam par grol ba'i @138b lus su bsdus pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i @138b lus su bsdus pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The worldly virtues of the disciples are included in the Liberated Body.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lus de'i rgyur gyur pa ni nyan thos rnams rnam par grol ba'i rgyur gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lus de'i rgyur gyur pa ni nyan thos rnams rnam par grol ba'i rgyur gyur ba ste /
translated: The Liberated Body is the cause of the disciples, because they are liberated from the obstacles to that.

original: gang las de 'ba' zhig pa'i rnam par grol bar 'gyur gyi chos kyi sku ni mi thob bo //
analyzed: gang las de 'ba' zhig pa'i rnam par grol bar 'gyur gyi chos kyi sku ni mi thob bo //
translated: From that, they are liberated only from that, but they do not obtain the Dharma Body.

original: ji ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pas rig par byed kyi rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pas rig par byed kyi rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pas ni ma yin te /
translated: It is known by the store-consciousness, not by the consciousness that is retribution,

original: 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: because the store-consciousness of one who has entered the samƒÅdhi of cessation is not absent.üîΩAnd because it is said that it is not dissociated from consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa dang mi 'brel pa'i zhes gsungs pas zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid du grub bo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang mi 'brel pa'i zhes gsungs pas zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid du grub bo //
translated: the existence of the store-consciousness is established.

original: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di'i rnam par shes pa lus las 'das pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa de ni rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa ma yin pa gzhan la mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di'i rnam par shes pa lus las 'das pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa de ni rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa ma yin pa gzhan la mi rung ngo //
translated: The statement of the Lord that consciousness is not absent from the body does not apply to any other consciousness except the consciousness that is retribution.

original: gang gi phyir 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i gnyen po skyes pa na de ni zhi ba nyid mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i gnyen po skyes pa na de ni zhi ba nyid mthong ngo //
translated: Because when one has entered the samƒÅdhi of cessation, the antidote to the active forms of consciousness has arisen, and that is seen to be peace.

original: yang gal te rtog pa skyes pa na de yang 'byung bas de las dgongs nas ma 'das pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: yang gal te rtog pa skyes pa na de yang 'byung bas de las dgongs nas ma 'das pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes zer na /
translated: Again, if it is said that since it arises when conception arises, it is said that it does not transcend that,

original: de ni mi rung ste gang gi phyir de dag ni de las langs pa na yang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni mi rung ste gang gi phyir de dag ni de las langs pa na yang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: that is illogical because when they arise from that meditative attainment, they would arise.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gags pas nyid mtshams sbyor zhing sprel ba de gang gi phyir med na 'byung ba'i srid pa mngon par 'grub pa yang yod pa mi 'gyur ro /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gags pas nyid mtshams sbyor zhing sprel ba de gang gi phyir med na 'byung ba'i srid pa mngon par 'grub pa yang yod pa mi 'gyur ro /
translated: If the linking and connecting of the mindstream through the cessation of the maturational consciousness did not exist, then the establishment of the existence of the intermediate existence would not exist.

original: gang yang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod pas sems dang bcas pa'o snyam du sems pa de ltar na yang sems ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: gang yang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod pas sems dang bcas pa'o snyam du sems pa de ltar na yang sems ni mi rung ste /
translated: Also, if you think that the meditative attainment of cessation possesses mind because mental consciousness exists there, then mind is illogical.

original: snyoms par 'jug par mi rung ba'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rang gi mtshan nyid ji skad bstan pa por nas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bye brag la 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sems dang bcas pa nyid du 'dod pa de ni mi rung
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug par mi rung ba'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rang gi mtshan nyid ji skad bstan pa por nas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bye brag la 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sems dang bcas pa nyid du 'dod pa de ni mi rung
translated: Because it is not suitable to enter meditative attainment, the foundation consciousness, having been taught with its own characteristics, is not suitable to be the meditative attainment of cessation that is associated with mind, which is a specific type of the active forms of consciousness.

original: ngo // ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ngo // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: snyoms par 'jug pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa mi rigs te /
translated: It is not suitable to enter meditative attainment,

original: de la yod pa dang bral bar mthong ba'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i sems yin no //
analyzed: de la yod pa dang bral bar mthong ba'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i sems yin no //
translated: because it is a different mind that sees the absence of that which exists there.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba dag ni 'dir 'gog pa yin te /
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba dag ni 'dir 'gog pa yin te /
translated: In this case, the cessation of discriminations and feelings

original: de dang de ni 'gog pa'i yod pas de dang de 'gog pas rab tu bsgos pa de la snyoms par 'jug pa mi rigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang de ni 'gog pa'i yod pas de dang de 'gog pas rab tu bsgos pa de la snyoms par 'jug pa mi rigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: is the cessation of that, and it is not suitable to enter meditative attainment in that which is thoroughly imbued with the cessation of that.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod par khas len na ni skyon de med de /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod par khas len na ni skyon de med de /
translated: If one accepts the existence of the foundation consciousness, then this error does not occur.

original: de la gnas par 'dod pa'i de dang mi mthun pa de las gzhan @139a * //
analyzed: de la gnas par 'dod pa'i de dang mi mthun pa de las gzhan @139a * //
translated: Because it is a different mind that sees the absence of that which exists there, and it is not suitable to enter meditative attainment in that which is thoroughly imbued with the cessation of that.

original: pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba de'i gnyen po 'byung gi rnam par gsal bar bstan pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba de'i gnyen po 'byung gi rnam par gsal bar bstan pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
translated: The mind and mental factors that are its antidote do not occur, and the antidote to that does not occur either.

original: des na de las gzhan pa la ni sems de mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: des na de las gzhan pa la ni sems de mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the mind does not occur in anything other than that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dmigs pa dang rnam pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang rnam pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because its object and aspect are not perceived.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyun ni dmigs pa dang rnam par shes pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyun ni dmigs pa dang rnam par shes pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: The continuum of mind and mental factors is not without an object and aspect.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyang dmigs pa dang rnam pa med pa'i ngo bor mi 'gyur ba zhig na de dag gnyi ga la yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyang dmigs pa dang rnam pa med pa'i ngo bor mi 'gyur ba zhig na de dag gnyi ga la yang mi dmigs so //
translated: The mind of meditative equipoise would not have the nature of being without an object and aspect, but both are not perceived in that.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod par 'dod pa las ni rkyen 'di dag yod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod par 'dod pa las ni rkyen 'di dag yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the foundation consciousness is accepted, these conditions would not exist,

original: de'i rten nye bar gzung bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rten nye bar gzung bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are distinguished by the support of that.

original: de la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dge ba la sogs pa'i bye brag yod na rnam par shes pa de la dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa nyid du 'gyur na re zhig dge ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dge ba la sogs pa'i bye brag yod na rnam par shes pa de la dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa nyid du 'gyur na re zhig dge ba ni ma yin te /
translated: If the consciousness that enters the womb is virtuous and so on, then that consciousness would be virtuous, nonvirtuous, or indeterminate. But it is not virtuous because it would follow that it would be concomitant with roots of virtue, but that is contradictory.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan par thal bar 'gyur bas de ni 'gal lo ngo bo nyid kyis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan par thal bar 'gyur bas de ni 'gal lo ngo bo nyid kyis kyang ma yin no //
translated: It is also not virtuous by nature.

original: rnam par shes pa de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i mtshungs par ldan pa dang ma bral bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i mtshungs par ldan pa dang ma bral bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: That consciousness would be concomitant with virtue and nonvirtue and not be free from them.

original: snyam par 'jug pa'i sems dge ba nyid yin pas ma chags pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa mi 'dod pa'i yang thob par 'gyur na /
analyzed: snyam par 'jug pa'i sems dge ba nyid yin pas ma chags pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa mi 'dod pa'i yang thob par 'gyur na /
translated: Since the mind that enters the womb is virtuous, it would obtain the roots of virtue such as nonattachment and so on, even though they are not desired.

original: 'di ltar ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar ni mi 'dod de /
translated: But this is not asserted.

original: dge ba'i sems kyi khyad par gzhan la yang thams cad du de thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems kyi khyad par gzhan la yang thams cad du de thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that all other specific virtuous minds would also be so.

original: mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa la yang med pas mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa la yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa la yang med pas mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa la yang mi rigs te /
translated: Nor is it reasonable that it is nonvirtuous or neutral, because it is not nonvirtuous or neutral.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dus nyid na mi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad spangs pas des na mi dge ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dus nyid na mi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad spangs pas des na mi dge ba ma yin no //
translated: At the time of freedom from attachment, all roots of nonvirtue are abandoned, and therefore it is not nonvirtuous.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa ni dge ba yin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa ni dge ba yin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is not neutral because meditative attainment is virtuous.

original: 'di'i phyir yang de dge ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang de dge ba ma yin te /
translated: For this reason also, it is not virtuous.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba kun tu spyod par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba kun tu spyod par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because it would follow that it would engage discernment and feeling,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba med par dge ba nyid ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba med par dge ba nyid ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no virtue without roots of virtue.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba la kun tu spyod pa bzhin du 'du shes dang tshor ba la spyod par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba la kun tu spyod pa bzhin du 'du shes dang tshor ba la spyod par yang 'gyur te /
translated: It would engage discernment and feeling as it engages the roots of virtue.

original: rgyu la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference in cause.

original: des na 'di ltar rigs te /
analyzed: des na 'di ltar rigs te /
translated: Therefore this is reasonable.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kun tu spyod pa na gnyen po'i phyogs med pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kun tu spyod pa na gnyen po'i phyogs med pa nyid do //
translated: When it engages its counteragents, it does not engage their antidotes.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa mngon @139b du spyod pa na mi sdug pa la sogs pa med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa mngon @139b du spyod pa na mi sdug pa la sogs pa med pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when one engages in desire and so on, the absence of the repulsive and so on is not the cause of the absence of desire and so on.

original: de ltar de las sems gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de las sems gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, there is no other mind apart from that.

original: 'di ltar yang de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma yin pa sems gzhan yod na /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma yin pa sems gzhan yod na /
translated: If there were another mind apart from the store consciousness,

original: reg pa dmigs par thal bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: reg pa dmigs par thal bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: then contact would be perceived.

original: dge ba kun tu spyod par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba kun tu spyod par yang 'gyur te /
translated: And there would be the practice of virtue.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs gzhan bzhin du zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs gzhan bzhin du zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The rest is as before, that is, like the other states of composure.

original: de'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khyad par yod na /
analyzed: de'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khyad par yod na /
translated: Therefore, if there were a special form of actual consciousness in the state of composure that is a cessation,

original: des na de ni ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i shin tu sbyangs pa'i phyir mtshan nyid can gyi tshor ba bde ba'am /
analyzed: des na de ni ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i shin tu sbyangs pa'i phyir mtshan nyid can gyi tshor ba bde ba'am /
translated: then that would be a feeling that has the nature of extreme flexibility born of concentration, or else it would be a feeling of pleasure.

original: tshor ba sdug bsngal ba'i reg pa 'dor bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshor ba sdug bsngal ba'i reg pa 'dor bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be the cessation of contact that is accompanied by feeling.

original: des na rkyen de dag las bde ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa tshor ba dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rkyen de dag las bde ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa tshor ba dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, pleasure and neither-pleasure-nor-pain arise from those conditions.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i mthus mnyam par gzhag par 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de'i mthus mnyam par gzhag par 'gyur pa ste /
translated: Because the power of those conditions is such that they cause the mind to enter meditative equipoise.üîΩWe see that other specific states of meditative equipoise have the power to produce those feelings.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i khyad par gzhan dag la yang tshor ba de dag 'byung ba'i mthu yod pa mthong ba de bzhin du 'dir yang nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyu'i ngo bo reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba 'byung ba 'gyur na /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i khyad par gzhan dag la yang tshor ba de dag 'byung ba'i mthu yod pa mthong ba de bzhin du 'dir yang nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyu'i ngo bo reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba 'byung ba 'gyur na /
translated: In the same way, if feeling arises due to the condition of contact, which is the cause of rebirth,

original: de ni rigs pa nyid de /üîΩ'du shes rgyun chad pa tsam du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa nyid de / 'du shes rgyun chad pa tsam du 'gyur te /
translated: that is reasonable.üîΩIt would be mere cessation of ideation,

original: reg pa'i stor ba khas len pas de la ni 'du shes rgyun chad pa tsam du 'gyur na /
analyzed: reg pa'i stor ba khas len pas de la ni 'du shes rgyun chad pa tsam du 'gyur na /
translated: because you accept that contact ceases.

original: de ltar mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de ltar mi 'dod de /
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: gnyi ga yang rgyun chad par gsungs pas de'i phyir theg pa ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang rgyun chad par gsungs pas de'i phyir theg pa ni mi rung ngo //
translated: Because it is said that both contact and feeling cease. Therefore, the vehicle is untenable.

original: rnam par shes pa gzhan dang de dang lhan cig mtshungs par ldan pa'i reg pa yod na sems dang dad pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du 'byung bar 'gyur bar phyir na rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i reg pa 'byung bas de
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gzhan dang de dang lhan cig mtshungs par ldan pa'i reg pa yod na sems dang dad pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du 'byung bar 'gyur bar phyir na rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i reg pa 'byung bas de
translated: If there is contact concomitant with that consciousness and other consciousnesses, then the roots of virtue such as faith and so on would arise in the mind.

original: dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sems pa yang yod de zhes gsungs pas sems pa yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sems pa yang yod de zhes gsungs pas sems pa yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since contact concomitant with consciousness arises, intention that arises simultaneously with it also exists.

original: de 'byung bar 'gyur ba yod na dge ba'i sems mngon par 'du byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu spyod pa yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de 'byung bar 'gyur ba yod na dge ba'i sems mngon par 'du byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu spyod pa yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar ni mi 'dod do //
translated: If it exists, then since the virtuous mind is fully activated, the roots of virtue such as faith and so on would also arise, but that is unacceptable.

original: gal te ji skad bstan pa'i skyon rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir dang / 'gal ba spang bar bya ba dang / des sun dbyung ba'i phyir sems las byung ba'i phyir sems las byung ba bzhag nas sems tsam khas len par byed na de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: gal te ji skad bstan pa'i skyon rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir dang / 'gal ba spang bar bya ba dang / des sun dbyung ba'i phyir sems las byung ba'i phyir sems las byung ba bzhag nas sems tsam khas len par byed na de yang mi rung ste /
translated: If you accept that mind only exists because you posit mental factors after you have eliminated the faults that have been taught and you have eliminated contradictions and you have refuted that position, that is also illogical.

original: rten las brten pa dbyer mi rung ba'i phyir te /üîΩrten ni sems tsam mo //
analyzed: rten las brten pa dbyer mi rung ba'i phyir te / rten ni sems tsam mo //
translated: Because it is illogical to separate the supported from the support.üîΩThe support is mind only.

original: brten pa na sems las byung @140a * //
analyzed: brten pa na sems las byung @140a * //
translated: The supported is mental factors.

original: ba ste ; rten dang brten pa sems las byung ba dag 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas phan tshun med pa ma yin pas dus thams cad du de bzhin du 'jug pa na rten dang brten pa dag 'bad pa dang ldan pas kyang dbyer mi nus te /
analyzed: ba ste ; rten dang brten pa sems las byung ba dag 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas phan tshun med pa ma yin pas dus thams cad du de bzhin du 'jug pa na rten dang brten pa dag 'bad pa dang ldan pas kyang dbyer mi nus te /
translated: Since the support and the supported, mental factors, have not been separate from each other since beginningless samsara, they always function in that way. Therefore, the support and the supported cannot be separated by those who strive to do so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dpe yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dpe yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is an example.

original: gang dus thams cad du lhan cig 'jug pa'i rten pa de ni rten las dbyer rung bar yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dus thams cad du lhan cig 'jug pa'i rten pa de ni rten las dbyer rung bar yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is supported and always functions simultaneously with its support cannot be separated from its support.

original: skye ba dang 'jug pa la sogs pa la phan tshun med na ma yin pa'i phyir 'byung ba las gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jug pa la sogs pa la phan tshun med na ma yin pa'i phyir 'byung ba las gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: because they are mutually non-existent in regard to arising, entering, etc., like the derivative elements.

original: de bzhin du sems tsam las sems las byung ba yang dbyer mi rung ba'i phyir mi rigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems tsam las sems las byung ba yang dbyer mi rung ba'i phyir mi rigs so //
translated: In the same way, it is not reasonable that the mental factors are inseparable from mind, because mind-only is untenable.

original: gzhan yang rten pas brten pa dbye bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rten pas brten pa dbye bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not reasonable that the supported is separated from the support,

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba dag ni de'i mi mthun par 'gyur bas rnam par sun dbyung ba'i phyir kun tu spyod pa med la de las gzhan pa dag kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba dag ni de'i mi mthun par 'gyur bas rnam par sun dbyung ba'i phyir kun tu spyod pa med la de las gzhan pa dag kyang ma yin te /
translated: because feeling and conceptualization are not engaged in the activity of the mind, since they are adverse to it and are to be abandoned. Nor are the other mental factors,

original: mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is unreasonable.

original: rgyu gang gis she na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis she na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: kun tu 'gro ba nyid yin pa las de bzhin du med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba nyid yin pa las de bzhin du med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are not omnipresent in the same way as the mind,

original: de las gzhan pa dag kyang rnam pa de nyid kyis gzhan pa de la bye brag gi rgyu med pa'i phyir kun tu spyod pa med par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag kyang rnam pa de nyid kyis gzhan pa de la bye brag gi rgyu med pa'i phyir kun tu spyod pa med par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: and because the other mental factors are not engaged in the activity of the mind, since they are not different from it in that respect and there is no cause for a distinction.

original: de ltar na mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de ltar na mi 'dod de /
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: mthong ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it contradicts what is seen.

original: sems dang bcas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa brtag pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: sems dang bcas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa brtag pa rdzogs so /
translated: The examination of the meditative attainment with mind is completed.

original: // / da ni gang yang phyogs gnyis de'i don brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni gang yang phyogs gnyis de'i don brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the two parties should state their views.

original: gang yang gang dag 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas sems dang bcas pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: gang yang gang dag 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas sems dang bcas pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: The meditative attainment of cessation is with mind because it is with the mind consciousness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pas ni ma yin no snyam du sems so //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pas ni ma yin no snyam du sems so //
translated: It is not with the store consciousness.

original: yang de dag gi sems ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan par mi 'thad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang de dag gi sems ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan par mi 'thad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, they think that it is not tenable that the mind in that meditative attainment is virtuous, nonvirtuous, or indeterminate.

original: de ni dge ba nyid yin pas na re zhig mi dge ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni dge ba nyid yin pas na re zhig mi dge ba med pa nyid do //
translated: Since it is virtuous, it is not nonvirtuous.

original: lung du ma bstan pa spyod lam dang ldan pa dang / bzo'i gnas dang / sprul pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de la yang sprul pa dang med pa po nyid do //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa spyod lam dang ldan pa dang / bzo'i gnas dang / sprul pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de la yang sprul pa dang med pa po nyid do //
translated: It is not indeterminate because it is not a state of deportment, a state of skill in the arts, or a state of emanation.

original: 'on te rnam par smin pa lung du ma bstan pa yin na ni de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par smin pa lung du ma bstan pa yin na ni de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid yin te /
translated: If it is unmanifest neutral, then it is the foundation consciousness itself.

original: lung du ma bstan pa lnga ni med do //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa lnga ni med do //
translated: There are no five unmanifest neutral states.

original: gal te sems de dge ba yin na ni de la ma chags pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te sems de dge ba yin na ni de la ma chags pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: If that mind is virtuous, then it would be concomitant with the roots of virtue such as nonattachment.

original: de lta bu ni sems med pa yin na nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gnas gyur pas dge bar gyur ba'i @140b gnas skabs dge ba'i sems de la brten cing dmigs nas gsum 'dus pa'i reg pa ji ltar 'byung bar mi 'gyur /üîΩreg pa yod par gyur na de ltar na yang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bu ni sems med pa yin na nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gnas gyur pas dge bar gyur ba'i @140b gnas skabs dge ba'i sems de la brten cing dmigs nas gsum 'dus pa'i reg pa ji ltar 'byung bar mi 'gyur / reg pa yod par gyur na de ltar na yang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is mindless, then how could the contact that arises from the union of the three, the virtuous mind that is the basis of the transformation of afflicted mind and the object of that mind, occur?

original: de sems dang sems las byung ba ma 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de sems dang sems las byung ba ma 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If contact exists, then the meditative attainment of cessation would not be mindless because it would not stop the mind and mental factors.

original: yang la la dag dge ba'i sems kyis bde ba skyed pas dge ba ste /
analyzed: yang la la dag dge ba'i sems kyis bde ba skyed pas dge ba ste /
translated: Some say: It is virtuous because it generates pleasure through a virtuous mind.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa 'dren par byed pa'i sems kyi sbyor ba'i shugs kyis dge ba yin na yang bag chags la sogs pa dang lhan cig mtshungs par ldan pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa 'dren par byed pa'i sems kyi sbyor ba'i shugs kyis dge ba yin na yang bag chags la sogs pa dang lhan cig mtshungs par ldan pas ni ma yin te /
translated: Though it is virtuous since it is the power of the preparation of the mind that induces meditative attainment, it is not concomitant with the imprints and so on.

original: nus pa 'dus pa ni 'dus pa zhes bya ba nas so //
analyzed: nus pa 'dus pa ni 'dus pa zhes bya ba nas so //
translated: The power of the collection of potential is called the collection.

original: des na de ni dge ba yin yang skyed par byed pa gsum 'dus pa'i mthu ste /
analyzed: des na de ni dge ba yin yang skyed par byed pa gsum 'dus pa'i mthu ste /
translated: Therefore, though it is virtuous, it is the power of the three generating factors coming together.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba bzhin no zhes rtogs na /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba bzhin no zhes rtogs na /
translated: It is like the arising of a result that is a natural outflow.

original: de ci yang gang dang gang sbyor ba'i sems dge ba yin pa de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: de ci yang gang dang gang sbyor ba'i sems dge ba yin pa de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin la /
translated: If you understand that, then whatever virtuous mind is applied to anything, it is concomitant with roots of virtue.

original: des 'phangs pa yang ma chags pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des 'phangs pa yang ma chags pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: And that which is projected by that is concomitant with roots of virtue such as nonattachment.

original: de bas na snyoms par 'jug pa'i sbyor ba'am /
analyzed: de bas na snyoms par 'jug pa'i sbyor ba'am /
translated: Therefore, the preparation for meditative attainment

original: snyoms par 'jug pa de dag dang 'gal bar gnas pa'i bag chags la sogs pa rnams gang gi phyir mi 'jug la dge ba ni yang 'jug go zhes zer na /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa de dag dang 'gal bar gnas pa'i bag chags la sogs pa rnams gang gi phyir mi 'jug la dge ba ni yang 'jug go zhes zer na /
translated: But they do not enter those who are habituated to states that are incompatible with meditative attainment and so on, but they do enter those who are virtuous.üîΩ

original: gang de lta bu ni sus kyang mi 'dod de /
analyzed: gang de lta bu ni sus kyang mi 'dod de /
translated: But no one asserts that,üîΩbecause the homogeneous cause is not tenable.üîΩThe homogeneous cause is not tenable because the result of natural outflow is not tenable.üîΩThe result of natural outflow is not tenable because the cause and result are not simultaneous.üîΩThe cause and result are not simultaneous because the cause and result are not different.

analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yang gang gi phyir kun tu sbyor ba dang bcas pa'i chos rnams ni kun tu sbyor ba dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur / rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig gi dngos po nyid du gyur pa na /

original: de yang 'o ma dang chu mnyam par bsres pa bzhin no zhes bya bas dpes bstan to //
analyzed: de yang 'o ma dang chu mnyam par bsres pa bzhin no zhes bya bas dpes bstan to //
translated: The cause and result are not different because the cause and result are not simultaneous.üîΩThe cause and result are not different because the cause and result are not simultaneous

original: yang ji ltar 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gcig la mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags spangs pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa'i dge ba'i bag chags rgyas par rten gnas gyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang ji ltar 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gcig la mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags spangs pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa'i dge ba'i bag chags rgyas par rten gnas gyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, just as the single foundation consciousness of an ordinary being free from attachment is the support for the elimination of the latent afflictions of the stage of equipoise and the enhancement of the latent good of the stage of equipoise,

original: de bzhin du 'di la yang blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la yang blta bar bya ste /
translated: so it is here.

original: 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa de yang rnam par shes pa med pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa des ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de yod pa nyid du bsgrubs so /üîΩ// / bam po gsum pa /üîΩgang bcom ldan 'das @141a * //
analyzed: 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa de yang rnam par shes pa med pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa des ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de yod pa nyid du bsgrubs so / // / bam po gsum pa / gang bcom ldan 'das @141a * //
translated: The statement that ‚Äúeven when one enters the absorption of cessation, consciousness is not absent‚Äù proves that foundation consciousness exists.

original: kyis 'di'i rnam par shes pa lus las ma 'das so zhes gsungs pa de rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa ma yin pa gzhan la mi 'thad de /
analyzed: kyis 'di'i rnam par shes pa lus las ma 'das so zhes gsungs pa de rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa ma yin pa gzhan la mi 'thad de /
translated: The statement by the BhagavƒÅn that ‚Äúconsciousness does not depart from the body‚Äù is untenable as referring to any consciousness other than the maturational consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa spangs pas mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa spangs pas mi 'byung ste /
translated: Because the consciousness that enters the meditative attainment of cessation does not occur when it is abandoned.

original: de ni zhi bar mthong bas so //
analyzed: de ni zhi bar mthong bas so //
translated: Because it is seen as peace.

original: yang gang la la langs pa na de yang 'byung bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir de las dgongs nas ma 'das pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes rtogs na /
analyzed: yang gang la la langs pa na de yang 'byung bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir de las dgongs nas ma 'das pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes rtogs na /
translated: If you think that it is said that one does not transcend that meditative attainment because it occurs again when one arises from it,

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: that is illogical.

original: de dag gi ltar na rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i nyid mtshams sbyor zhing sprel ba gang rgyun chad ce med na /
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i nyid mtshams sbyor zhing sprel ba gang rgyun chad ce med na /
translated: According to you, if the linking and connecting of the consciousness that is karmic maturation is uninterrupted,

original: mngon par 'grub pa rigs par mi 'gyur bas langs pa na yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa rigs par mi 'gyur bas langs pa na yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: it would not be logical for it to be established, and therefore it would not occur again when one arises from that meditative attainment.

original: gang yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma yin par yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang bcas pas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sems dang bcas pa nyid yin no snyam du sems pas de bas na de ltar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gang yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma yin par yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang bcas pas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sems dang bcas pa nyid yin no snyam du sems pas de bas na de ltar mi 'thad do //
translated: Also, if you think that the meditative attainment of cessation is associated with mind because it is associated with mental consciousness, not with foundation consciousness, then that is illogical.

original: 'di ltar na yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar na yang mi 'thad de /
translated: But that is not tenable.

original: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis lus kyi 'du byed 'gag par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis lus kyi 'du byed 'gag par 'gyur zhing /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has said, ‚ÄúThe formative factors of the body cease,

original: yid kyi 'du byed ni dbugs 'byung bar dang rngub pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi 'du byed ni dbugs 'byung bar dang rngub pa'o //
translated: and the formative factors of the mind are exhalation and inhalation.

original: ngag gi 'du byed ni rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gi 'du byed ni rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa'o //
translated: The formative factors of speech are discursive thought and investigation.

original: yid kyi 'du byed ni sems pa dang 'du shes so zhes gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: yid kyi 'du byed ni sems pa dang 'du shes so zhes gsungs pa de la /
translated: The formative factors of the mind are intention and discernment.‚Äù

original: ji ltar rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa 'gag par gyur na ngag 'jug par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa 'gag par gyur na ngag 'jug par mi 'gyur la /
translated: How could speech engage when discursive thought and investigation have ceased?

original: de bzhin du yid kyi 'du byed 'gag par gyur na yid 'jug par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyi 'du byed 'gag par gyur na yid 'jug par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, how could the mind engage when the formative factors of the mind have ceased?

original: gal te ji ltar snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na lus kyi 'du byed 'gags na yang lus gnas par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na lus kyi 'du byed 'gags na yang lus gnas par 'gyur la /
translated: If you assert that just as the formative factors of the body cease at the time of entering meditative attainment but the body remains,

original: de bzhin du yid kyi 'du byed 'gags par gyur kyang yid gnas par 'gyur ro zhes 'dod na /
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyi 'du byed 'gags par gyur kyang yid gnas par 'gyur ro zhes 'dod na /
translated: similarly, the formative factors of the mind cease but the mind remains,

original: de ltar bu de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de ltar bu de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: that is not tenable.

original: gang lus gnas pa ni rgyu rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang yin te /
analyzed: gang lus gnas pa ni rgyu rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang yin te /
translated: The body is also maintained by other causes.

original: lus kyi 'du byed pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lus kyi 'du byed pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has stated that the formative forces of the body are as follows:

original: zas dang / srog gi dbang po dang rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: zas dang / srog gi dbang po dang rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: food, the faculty of life, and consciousness.

original: gang dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba med na yang gnas par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: gang dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba med na yang gnas par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: The body is maintained even when there is no inhalation and exhalation.

original: yid la ni 'du byed pa nyid gzhan med pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang rnam par gnas pa de med na /
analyzed: yid la ni 'du byed pa nyid gzhan med pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang rnam par gnas pa de med na /
translated: Since there are no other formative forces of the mind apart from the mind consciousness, when the mind consciousness is absent,

original: sems med pa'i gnas skabs nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems med pa'i gnas skabs nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: the state of unconsciousness is attained.

original: rnam par smin @141b pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid la bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa'i sgrar gsungs pa 'dod pas /
analyzed: rnam par smin @141b pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid la bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa'i sgrar gsungs pa 'dod pas /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has stated that consciousness refers to the consciousness that is the result of karmic ripening.

original: des na yang langs pa na sa bon thams cad la las 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: des na yang langs pa na sa bon thams cad la las 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, when one arises from that state, the consciousness that engages all the seeds arises again.

original: gang yang gzugs dang sems kyi mjug thogs su 'byung ba chos rnams kyi sa bon du rtog pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang yang gzugs dang sems kyi mjug thogs su 'byung ba chos rnams kyi sa bon du rtog pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The second theory is that the seeds of all phenomena are the prior moment of form and mind.

original: gzugs kyi skad cig snga ma ni gzugs kyi skad cig phyi ma'i rgyu nyid rnam par shes pa'i sa bon nyid rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skad cig snga ma ni gzugs kyi skad cig phyi ma'i rgyu nyid rnam par shes pa'i sa bon nyid rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The prior moment of form is the cause of the subsequent moment of form, and the prior moment of consciousness is the seed of consciousness.

original: de la gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos pa'i gzugs na'i 'gags nas ring du lon par gyur na yang 'byung ba'i rgyur gzugs ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de la gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos pa'i gzugs na'i 'gags nas ring du lon par gyur na yang 'byung ba'i rgyur gzugs ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: But if form has ceased for a long time in one who has died and transmigrated from the formless realm, how could form arise from that cause?

original: 'du shes med pa nas shi 'phos pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las langs pa'i tshe yang de'i sems ni 'gags nas ring du lon par gyur na sems 'byung ba de'i rgyu nyid du sems de ji ltar 'gyur /

translated: And if the mind has ceased for a long time in one who has died and transmigrated from the state of nondiscernment or from the state of composure that is a cessation, how could the mind arise from that cause?

original: de lta yin na dgra bcom pa'i phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de lta yin na dgra bcom pa'i phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yang mi 'thad de /

original: rgyu gzugs dang sems dag zad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu gzugs dang sems dag zad pa med pa'i phyir ro //

original: gang 'das pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid kyi dang po'i gzugs kyi skad cig las ni gzugs /
analyzed: gang 'das pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid kyi dang po'i gzugs kyi skad cig las ni gzugs /
translated: Form arises from the first moment of form that is the immediately preceding condition of that which has passed.üîΩ

original: rnam par shes pa las ni rnam par shes pa 'byung bar blta bar bya'i rgyu'i rkyen las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las ni rnam par shes pa 'byung bar blta bar bya'i rgyu'i rkyen las ni ma yin no //
translated: The form that arises from the first moment of form, which is the immediately preceding condition of the past, is seen to arise from form, and consciousness is seen to arise from consciousness, but not from a causal condition.

original: de ltar na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid du 'grub bo //
analyzed: de ltar na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid du 'grub bo //

analyzed: ji ltar na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la gnas pa tsam gyis rten gnas par gyur par mi rigs pa de tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis bstan te /

analyzed: dngos po med par byas pas de ni dngos po med pa'o //

original: des na de ltar 'gyur ba rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de ltar 'gyur ba rung ba ma yin no //

original: dngos po med par bya bar nus so //
analyzed: dngos po med par bya bar nus so //

original: de la bag chags rnam pa gsum gyi bye brag gis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la bag chags rnam pa gsum gyi bye brag gis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In order to demonstrate the specific forms of the storehouse consciousness that is established in this way, the root text states, ‚ÄúIt is distinguished by the three types of perfuming.‚Äù

analyzed: de la mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi bye brag ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The specific latent afflictions of verbal expression are as follows.

original: mig ces rjod par byed pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bag chags de ni mig mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig ces rjod par byed pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bag chags de ni mig mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyur 'gyur te /

original: mig gang grub cing rnam par smin pa las skyes par brjod par bya ba de mig ces brjod pa'i rgyu las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mig gang grub cing rnam par smin pa las skyes par brjod par bya ba de mig ces brjod pa'i rgyu las gyur pa'o //
translated: The eye that is established and that is said to be born from fruitional causes is the cause for the expression ‚Äúeye.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa brjod par bya ba thams cad la zhes bya ba ni 'di'i bye brag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa brjod par bya ba thams cad la zhes bya ba ni 'di'i bye brag go //

analyzed: @142b bdag tu lta ba'i bag chags kyi bye brag ces bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dbang gis nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gang gis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las bdag ces bag chags sgo bar byed de /
translated: The specific latent afflictions of the view of self are as follows. By the power of the view of the transitory collection, the afflicted mind imprints the latent afflictions of self in the foundation consciousness.

original: gang gis bdag ces bya ba dang / gzhan zhes bya ba'i bye brag 'dir 'gyur bar byed do //
analyzed: gang gis bdag ces bya ba dang / gzhan zhes bya ba'i bye brag 'dir 'gyur bar byed do //
translated: By this, the distinction of self and other is made.

original: srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags kyi bye brag ces bya ba ni gang dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed mthar thug pa med par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags kyi bye brag ces bya ba ni gang dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed mthar thug pa med par 'jug pa ste /
translated: The specific latent impressions of the members of cyclic existence are the final, endless engagement of virtuous, nonvirtuous, and unmoving formative forces.

original: 'di dag ni ji ltar shes bya'i mtshan nyid rgyas pa nyid du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni ji ltar shes bya'i mtshan nyid rgyas pa nyid du bshad par bya'o //
translated: These should be explained in detail in accordance with the characteristics of the knowable.

original: de la 'phen pas rab tu dbye ba ni zhes bya bas ni 'phags pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag go //
analyzed: de la 'phen pas rab tu dbye ba ni zhes bya bas ni 'phags pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag go //
translated: The classification by projection is the specific aspect of the ƒÅryas.

original: bag chags gsar du 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni gang dang por byung ba'i bag chags de ste /
analyzed: bag chags gsar du 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni gang dang por byung ba'i bag chags de ste /
translated: The newly arising latent impressions are those that first occur.

original: bye brag de skad du brjod pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de med du zin na 'du byed 'byung ba dang 'gags pas yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa dang len pas yongs su gzung ba'i 'byung ba'i srid pa la mngon par phyogs pas byas pa'iüîΩsrid pa mi rung ngo //
analyzed: bye brag de skad du brjod pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de med du zin na 'du byed 'byung ba dang 'gags pas yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa dang len pas yongs su gzung ba'i 'byung ba'i srid pa la mngon par phyogs pas byas pa'i srid pa mi rung ngo //
translated: If that foundation consciousness that is described in such a way did not exist, existence created by the consciousness that is infused by the arising and cessation of formative forces and appropriated by the grasping of the foundation consciousness would not be tenable.

original: srid pa ste /
analyzed: srid pa ste /
translated: Existence would not be tenable.

original: 'di las skye ba mngon par grub pas na srid pa'o //üîΩ'di ni len pa zhes bya ba dge ba'am /
analyzed: 'di las skye ba mngon par grub pas na srid pa'o // 'di ni len pa zhes bya ba dge ba'am /
translated: Existence is so called because it is the establishment of rebirth.

original: mi dge ba goms pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba goms pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: Clinging is so called because it is the result of the habituation to virtue and nonvirtue.

original: de la rnam par smin pas rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni gang 'du byed dang / srid pa'i rkyen gyis 'phangs pa'i 'gro ba dag tu rnam par smin pa ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pas rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni gang 'du byed dang / srid pa'i rkyen gyis 'phangs pa'i 'gro ba dag tu rnam par smin pa ste /
translated: The classification of the result of evolution is that which is projected by the condition of the formations and existence into the destinies of rebirth.

original: rnam par smin pa zhes brjod pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bye brag de med du zin na rgyu med pas yang srid pa can nyid kyi chos gzugs can gyi dbang por mig la sogs pa rnams 'byung bar rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa zhes brjod pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bye brag de med du zin na rgyu med pas yang srid pa can nyid kyi chos gzugs can gyi dbang por mig la sogs pa rnams 'byung bar rung ba ma yin te /
translated: If that particular store consciousness which is called the result of evolution did not exist, then the eye and so on, which are material and are the support of the dharmas that have a new existence, would not occur without a cause.

original: de ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yin pas so //
analyzed: de ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yin pas so //
translated: This is because they are the result of evolution.

original: de la rgyu nyid du rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba la yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de nyid la yid rten pa'i phyir bdag tu blta ba dang / bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bye brag ste /
analyzed: de la rgyu nyid du rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba la yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de nyid la yid rten pa'i phyir bdag tu blta ba dang / bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bye brag ste /
translated: The so-called classification by way of cause is the special foundation consciousness, the cause of the view of self and the cause of the apprehension of self.

original: rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba de med na 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu gang yin pa yid kyis bdag tu bang ba de'i dmigs pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba de med na 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu gang yin pa yid kyis bdag tu bang ba de'i dmigs pa mi rigs te /
translated: If that so-called cause did not exist, then the object of observation of the mental apprehension of self, which is the cause of the view of the transitory collection, would be impossible.

original: de ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin pas so //
analyzed: de ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin pas so //
translated: Because that is the result that is similar to the cause.

original: de la mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The so-called classification by way of characteristic is

original: de ni rnam pa mang du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa mang du 'byung ngo //
translated: that it occurs in many ways.

original: de yang thun mong gi mtshan nyid dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid dang / tshor ba med pa 'byung ba'i sa bon gyi @143a * //
analyzed: de yang thun mong gi mtshan nyid dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid dang / tshor ba med pa 'byung ba'i sa bon gyi @143a * //
translated: Moreover, it is the common characteristic, the uncommon characteristic, and the seed of the arising of feeling.

original: mtshan nyid dang / tshor ba dang bcas pa 'byung ba'i sa bon gyi mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang / tshor ba dang bcas pa 'byung ba'i sa bon gyi mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the seed of the arising of that which is without feeling is the characteristic of the seed of that which is accompanied by feeling. This is the brief explanation.

original: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni sems can thams cad kyi thun mong gi snod kyi 'jig rten rgyur gyur pas na /
analyzed: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni sems can thams cad kyi thun mong gi snod kyi 'jig rten rgyur gyur pas na /
translated: The store-consciousness is the cause of the world of sentient beings and the world of the physical environment, which are shared in common by all sentient beings.

original: tshor ba med pa 'byung ba'i sa bon no //
analyzed: tshor ba med pa 'byung ba'i sa bon no //
translated: It is the seed of the arising of that which is without feeling.

original: gang thun mong ma yin pa zhes bya ba de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa so so rang gi gzugs la sogs pa dang / skye mched rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gang thun mong ma yin pa zhes bya ba de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa so so rang gi gzugs la sogs pa dang / skye mched rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa ste /
translated: That which is not shared in common is the store-consciousness as the cause of the individual form, etc., and the sense-fields of each sentient being.
