original: de ni tshor ba dang bcas pa 'byung ba'i sa bon no //
analyzed: de ni tshor ba dang bcas pa 'byung ba'i sa bon no //
translated: It is the seed of the arising of that which is accompanied by feeling.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi kun gzhi rnam par kun shes pa med na gang sems can thams cad kyi thun mong gi longs spyod kyi rgyur gyur pa snod kyi 'jig rten yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi kun gzhi rnam par kun shes pa med na gang sems can thams cad kyi thun mong gi longs spyod kyi rgyur gyur pa snod kyi 'jig rten yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were no store-consciousness with such a nature, the world of the physical environment, which is the cause of the shared enjoyment of all sentient beings, would not exist.

original: de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnyis pa med na yang sems can gyi 'jig rten yod par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnyis pa med na yang sems can gyi 'jig rten yod par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Likewise, if there were no second kind of consciousness, the storehouse consciousness, the world of sentient beings would not exist.

original: des na shing bzhin du tshor ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na shing bzhin du tshor ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, like a tree, feeling would not occur.

original: yang gnas ngan len gyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni gang rten las su mi rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: yang gnas ngan len gyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni gang rten las su mi rung ba nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of negative reflex action is that which is unserviceability of the support.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa'i mtshan nyid ni gang las su rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa'i mtshan nyid ni gang las su rung ba nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of serviceability is that which is serviceability.

original: spyad zin pa'i mtshan nyid ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na yang dang yang du byas pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las gang gis 'bras bu 'byung ba zad par 'gyur ba de yod par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: spyad zin pa'i mtshan nyid ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na yang dang yang du byas pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las gang gis 'bras bu 'byung ba zad par 'gyur ba de yod par mi rung ngo //
translated: The characteristic of the exhaustion of the results of past action is that, even if there were no storehouse consciousness, the results of past good and bad action would not occur again after being produced once.

original: ma spyad pa'i mtshan nyid ni gang mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon te zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi bye brag ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ma spyad pa'i mtshan nyid ni gang mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon te zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi bye brag ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the non-exhaustion of the results of past action is that which is the seed of the instinct for verbal expression.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas spros pa 'byung bas sa bon yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas spros pa 'byung bas sa bon yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is the seed of conceptual elaboration since beginningless time.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas yang dag pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyur gyur pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes brjod pa de med na mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags gsar du 'byung ba yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas yang dag pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyur gyur pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes brjod pa de med na mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags gsar du 'byung ba yang mi 'thad do //
translated: If there were no foundation consciousness, which is the cause of correct conventions since beginningless time, it would be untenable that the imprints of expressions newly arise.

original: rnying rnams med pas de'i phyir da ltar gyi mngon par brjod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnying rnams med pas de'i phyir da ltar gyi mngon par brjod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And because the old ones do not exist, there would be no present expressions.

original: snga na med par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: snga na med par yang 'gyur te /
translated: They would be nonexistent before.

original: gang 'jig rten na thog ma med pa nas ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang 'jig rten na thog ma med pa nas ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not occur in the world since beginningless time.üîΩThe definition of the example is this: Just as a magician is the cause of the illusion of an elephant, etc.,

original: dpe'i mtshan nyid ni ci sgyu ma sgyu ma byas pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas 'khrul pa'i glang po la sogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur pa de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dpe'i mtshan nyid du bstan pa yang yang dag par ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i
analyzed: dpe'i mtshan nyid ni ci sgyu ma sgyu ma byas pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas 'khrul pa'i glang po la sogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur pa de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dpe'i mtshan nyid du bstan pa yang yang dag par ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i
translated: and thus the cause of the error of an elephant, etc., so too the foundation consciousness, which is taught as the definition of the example, is the cause of the error of the appearance of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: sa bon yin pas phyin ci log gi rgyu mtshan yin te /
analyzed: sa bon yin pas phyin ci log gi rgyu mtshan yin te /
translated: It is the cause of error because it is the seed.

original: de med na rgyu mtshan @143b nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de med na rgyu mtshan @143b nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: If it did not exist, there would be no cause for error.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Unobscured-indeterminate.

original: ma bsgribs pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: ma bsgribs pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ste /
translated: Unobscured means not defiled.

original: nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa dang lung du ma bstan pa ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa dang lung du ma bstan pa ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: That which is defiled and indeterminate is unobscured-indeterminate.

original: ji ltar gzugs kyi khams su skye bas nyon mongs pa dang / dge ba ma yin pa dang lung du ma bstan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs kyi khams su skye bas nyon mongs pa dang / dge ba ma yin pa dang lung du ma bstan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For example, when one is born in the form realm, there is no defiled or nonvirtuous indeterminate form.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa nyid yod na kun nas nyon mongs par ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa nyid yod na kun nas nyon mongs par ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were a virtuous or nonvirtuous karmic maturation, then there would be no cessation of affliction.

original: de'i phyir na dge ba las dge ba dang / dge ba las mi dge bar 'byung bas 'dus byas la mthar thug pa med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir na dge ba las dge ba dang / dge ba las mi dge bar 'byung bas 'dus byas la mthar thug pa med de /
translated: Therefore, since virtue arises from virtue and nonvirtue arises from virtue, there is no finality to the conditioned.

original: des na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pas 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pas 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the life-cycle is due to the defilement and the good with-outflows.

original: shes bya'i mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas nas bstan pa la de la gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: shes bya'i mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas nas bstan pa la de la gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: The teaching in terms of the characteristics of the knowable is as follows: What is the characteristic of the other-dependent?

original: de ni mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba ni yang dag par bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba ni yang dag par bsdus pa'o //
translated: It is in brief, etc. means it is well summarized.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pas bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa'o ;
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pas bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa'o ;
translated: It is included in unreal imagination means it is unreal imagination.

original: ; lus dang / lus can dang / zab po'i rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: ; lus dang / lus can dang / zab po'i rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba de la /
translated: The consciousness of the body, the embodied one, and the experiencer.

original: lus ni mig la sogs pa'i khams lnga'o //
analyzed: lus ni mig la sogs pa'i khams lnga'o //
translated: The body is the five elements beginning with the eye.

original: lus can ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do //
analyzed: lus can ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do //
translated: The embodied one is the defiled mental organ.

original: za ba po ni yid kyi khams so //
analyzed: za ba po ni yid kyi khams so //
translated: The experiencer is the element of mind.

original: des nye bar spyad par bya ba'i rnam par rig pa ni phyir rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i khams drug go //
analyzed: des nye bar spyad par bya ba'i rnam par rig pa ni phyir rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i khams drug go //
translated: The consciousness of what is to be experienced by that is the six external elements beginning with form.

original: de la nye bar spyod pa'i rnam par rig pa ni rnam par shes pa drug gi khams so //
analyzed: de la nye bar spyod pa'i rnam par rig pa ni rnam par shes pa drug gi khams so //
translated: The representation of experience is the six sense-fields of consciousness.

original: dus kyi rnam par rig pa ni 'khor ba'i rgyun 'jug pa rnam par chad pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: dus kyi rnam par rig pa ni 'khor ba'i rgyun 'jug pa rnam par chad pa med pa nyid do //
translated: The representation of time is the uninterrupted continuity of cyclic existence.

original: grangs kyi rnam par rig pa ni bgrang ba'o //
analyzed: grangs kyi rnam par rig pa ni bgrang ba'o //
translated: The representation of number is counting.

original: yul gyi rnam par rig pa ni snod kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: yul gyi rnam par rig pa ni snod kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: The representation of place is the physical world.

original: tha snyad kyi rnam par rig pa ni mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi rnam par rig pa ni mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The representation of conventional usage is what is seen, heard, known, and perceived.

original: tha snyad rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: tha snyad rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: These are the four kinds of conventional usage.

original: re zhig de lta bu'i rnam par rig pa dag ni shes bya'i gnas su bstan pa ni mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi rgyu can yin no //
analyzed: re zhig de lta bu'i rnam par rig pa dag ni shes bya'i gnas su bstan pa ni mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi rgyu can yin no //
translated: Thus, these representations are taught to be the basis of what is to be known, and they are the cause of the latent impressions of verbal expression.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi bye brag gi rnam par rig pa gang yin pa'i bye brag gi rten ni bdag tu lta ba'i bag chags kyi rgyu can no //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi bye brag gi rnam par rig pa gang yin pa'i bye brag gi rten ni bdag tu lta ba'i bag chags kyi rgyu can no //
translated: The representation of the distinction between self and other is the basis of the distinction, and it is the cause of the latent impressions of the view of self.

original: gang bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba'i rnam par rig pa ste /
analyzed: gang bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba'i rnam par rig pa ste /
translated: The various destinies of cyclic existence are the result of the seeds of the instinct for misknowledge that is the root of cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba'i 'gro ba sna tshogs de ni srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags kyi sa bon nye bar len pa las byung ngo //üîΩrnam par rig @144a * //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'gro ba sna tshogs de ni srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags kyi sa bon nye bar len pa las byung ngo // rnam par rig @144a * //
translated: The various destinies of cyclic existence are the result of the seeds of the instinct for misknowledge that is the root of cyclic existence.

original: pa 'di rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i rnam par rig pa dag go //
analyzed: pa 'di rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i rnam par rig pa dag go //
translated: These consciousnesses means the consciousnesses just mentioned.

original: khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas thams cad bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni khams gsum dang de'i khongs su gtogs pa 'gro ba rnams pa lnga dang / skye gnas rnam pa bzhi dag kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas thams cad bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni khams gsum dang de'i khongs su gtogs pa 'gro ba rnams pa lnga dang / skye gnas rnam pa bzhi dag kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The inclusion of all realms, destinies, and birth processes refers to the defiled realms, destinies, and birth processes.

original: bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni de'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni de'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Inclusion means their nature.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid de /
translated: The relative reality is the nature of the relative.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the unreal imagination.

original: rnam par rig pa 'di rnams kyi rnam par rig pa tsam nyid yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pas bsdus pa zhes bya ba de la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pas bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni de'i ngo bo nyid do
analyzed: rnam par rig pa 'di rnams kyi rnam par rig pa tsam nyid yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pas bsdus pa zhes bya ba de la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pas bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni de'i ngo bo nyid do
translated: The mere representation of these representations is subsumed by unreal imagination. The subsumption of the mere representation of these representations by unreal imagination is their reality.

original: // yod pa ma yin pa dang / nor pa'i don snang ba'i gnas gang yin pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pa dang / nor ba'i don snang ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: // yod pa ma yin pa dang / nor pa'i don snang ba'i gnas gang yin pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pa dang / nor ba'i don snang ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: The basis of the appearance of unreal and erroneous objects is the cause of the appearance of unreal and erroneous objects.

original: de la yod pa ma yin pa ni med pa ste /
analyzed: de la yod pa ma yin pa ni med pa ste /
translated: Among them, unreal means non-existent.

original: 'di ltar bdag gi ngo bo don de bzhin du yod par bzung nas de nyid la bdag med par bdag ces snang ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gi ngo bo don de bzhin du yod par bzung nas de nyid la bdag med par bdag ces snang ba ste /
translated: Thus, having grasped the essence of the self as existing in that way, the self appears as non-existent in that very [self].

original: de'i gnas ni snang ba'i gnas te rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i gnas ni snang ba'i gnas te rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Its basis is the basis of appearance, which means the cause.

original: de lta bu ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bu ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Such is the characteristic of the dependent.

original: kun tu rtog pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of the imagined?

original: gang don med kyang 'di ltar bden pa nyid du snang ba'o //üîΩrnam par rig pa tsam ste don nyid du zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don gyi snang ba ste /
analyzed: gang don med kyang 'di ltar bden pa nyid du snang ba'o // rnam par rig pa tsam ste don nyid du zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don gyi snang ba ste /
translated: It is that which appears as true even though it is not real.üîΩIt is mere representation, i.e., the appearance of an unreal object.

original: 'di ltar bdag nyid kyi don snang ba tsam de'i snang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag nyid kyi don snang ba tsam de'i snang ba'o //
translated: It is the appearance of the mere representation of an object, i.e., the appearance of the object itself.

original: don nyid du snang ba zhes bya ba ni gzung ba nyid du snang ba ste /
analyzed: don nyid du snang ba zhes bya ba ni gzung ba nyid du snang ba ste /
translated: The appearance as an object is the appearance as the apprehended object.

original: 'di ltar bdag med pa de bdag tu snang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag med pa de bdag tu snang ba'o //
translated: It is the appearance as a self, i.e., the appearance of a self where there is no self.

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni gang yod pa ma yin pa mi bden pa snang ba'i rgyu don de'i bdag nyid du snang ba gtan med par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni gang yod pa ma yin pa mi bden pa snang ba'i rgyu don de'i bdag nyid du snang ba gtan med par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The characteristic of the perfected is the non-existence of the appearance of the unreal cause of the appearance of the object, i.e., the appearance as the self of that object.

original: 'di ltar bdag tu snang ba gtan med par gyur pa nyid ni bdag med pa tsam yod par gyur ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag tu snang ba gtan med par gyur pa nyid ni bdag med pa tsam yod par gyur ba nyid yin te /
translated: The non-existence of the appearance as a self is the existence of mere selflessness.

original: 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa tsam mo zhes bya ba sa bcu pa las gsungs pa dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa tsam mo zhes bya ba sa bcu pa las gsungs pa dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: This is mere representation, as it is said in the Dasabhumika, and in the Samdhinirmocana Sutra:

original: rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa rnam par rig pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba can no zhes ngas bshad do zhes gsungs pa des na dmigs pa rnam par rig pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba can de ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa rnam par rig pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba can no zhes ngas bshad do zhes gsungs pa des na dmigs pa rnam par rig pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba can de ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid de /
translated: Therefore, that which is distinguished by the mere representation of an object is just the representation of consciousness.

original: don gyis stong pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don gyis stong pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said to be empty of objects.

original: rnam @144b par shes pa zhes ngas bshad do zhes bya ba'i rnam par shes pa smos pa des ni ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi rnam par shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: rnam @144b par shes pa zhes ngas bshad do zhes bya ba'i rnam par shes pa smos pa des ni ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi rnam par shes pa bstan to //
translated: The word consciousness in the phrase I explain that consciousness is distinguished by the mere representation of an object indicates the consciousness that is the object of concentration.

original: 'on kyang de ltar skyes pa'i zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de lta bur skyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ltar skyes pa'i zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de lta bur skyes pa'o //
translated: However, the phrase born in that way indicates that it is born in that way.

original: des na don tha dad par snang ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des na don tha dad par snang ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, the phrase the appearance of a different object

original: de las zhes byas bas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul las so //
analyzed: de las zhes byas bas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul las so //
translated: The phrase from that indicates from the object of concentration.

original: don tha dad par zhes bya ba ni gzung ba'i ngo bo nyid du rnam par chad pa lta bur rnam par shes pa snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: don tha dad par zhes bya ba ni gzung ba'i ngo bo nyid du rnam par chad pa lta bur rnam par shes pa snang ba nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúDistinct objects‚Äù means that consciousness appears as if it were divided into the nature of the object that is grasped.

original: rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan ni rnam par shes pas dran pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan ni rnam par shes pas dran pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The reflection that is the object of the meditative concentration on the blue lotus, etc., is not remembered by consciousness,

original: gang gi phyir ji lta ba bzhin du yul na gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji lta ba bzhin du yul na gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is located in a different place.

original: de bzhin du nyams su myong ba ni dran pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyams su myong ba ni dran pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, the experience is not remembered,

original: mdun du byas pa mthong ba'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pas dran pa'i don ni mi gsal ba yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: mdun du byas pa mthong ba'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pas dran pa'i don ni mi gsal ba yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: because it is seen in front, and because the meaning of ‚Äúremembered by consciousness‚Äù is unclear.

original: mdun na gnas pa 'di ni gsal bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang gal te ji ltar thos pa dang / bsams pa dang ; goms par byas pa de ni ring du 'das par gyur na yang /
analyzed: mdun na gnas pa 'di ni gsal bar mthong ba'i phyir ro // gzhan yang gal te ji ltar thos pa dang / bsams pa dang ; goms par byas pa de ni ring du 'das par gyur na yang /
translated: This is because it is seen clearly in front.üîΩMoreover, if it is as you say, then what is heard, reflected upon, and cultivated would be just as if it were present,

original: ji ltar da ltar byung ba bzhin du de yang de bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar da ltar byung ba bzhin du de yang de bzhin no zhe na /
translated: even if it had passed a long time ago.

original: de la thos pa dang bsams pa ni 'das nas ring du lon pa nyid kyis med pa yin la /
analyzed: de la thos pa dang bsams pa ni 'das nas ring du lon pa nyid kyis med pa yin la /
translated: Since the nature of hearing and reflection is long past, it does not exist.üîΩSince the nature of hearing and reflection is long past, it does not exist.

original: thos pa dang bsams pa'i rang bzhin ni 'das nas ring du lon pas med pa'i phyir te med pa nyid yin te des na gang 'byung ba de ni rnam par shes pa nyid de /
analyzed: thos pa dang bsams pa'i rang bzhin ni 'das nas ring du lon pas med pa'i phyir te med pa nyid yin te des na gang 'byung ba de ni rnam par shes pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, that which arises is consciousness itself.

original: de lta bur snang bar gyur ba yin pas des na 'di dag ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du 'thad de /
analyzed: de lta bur snang bar gyur ba yin pas des na 'di dag ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du 'thad de /
translated: Since it appears in that way, it is tenable that these are only representations.

original: de'i phyir don med pa nyid du grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir don med pa nyid du grub bo //
translated: Therefore, the nonexistence of objects is established.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa rnams ni gzugs can ma yin pas rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du rigs na /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa rnams ni gzugs can ma yin pas rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du rigs na /
translated: Since representations such as eye consciousness are not physical, it is reasonable that they are only representations.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa gzugs can rnams ji ltar zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa gzugs can rnams ji ltar zhes bya ba de la /
translated: But how are the physical representations of the eye, etc.,

original: de dag kyang lung dang rigs pas blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang lung dang rigs pas blta bar bya ste /
translated: They should be viewed through scripture and reasoning,

original: snga ma bzhin no zhes bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no zhes bya bar bstan to //
translated: as in the previous example.

original: mtshungs la brtan par rgyun gyis 'jug //
analyzed: mtshungs la brtan par rgyun gyis 'jug //
translated: They are similar, stable, and continuous.

original: ces bya ba de la mtshungs pa ni 'dra ba'o ;
analyzed: ces bya ba de la mtshungs pa ni 'dra ba'o ;
translated: Similarity means likeness.

original: ; brtan pa ni dus gzhan du gnas pa'o //üîΩphyin ci log la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: ; brtan pa ni dus gzhan du gnas pa'o // phyin ci log la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: Stability means remaining for a time.üîΩ The defilement of error, etc.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pas zhes bya ba rgyur gyur pa dag go //üîΩgzhi'i gnas zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i ngo bo'o 'di dag nyid gzhan du 'jug par 'gyur na don ma yin pa la don yin @145a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pas zhes bya ba rgyur gyur pa dag go // gzhi'i gnas zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i ngo bo'o 'di dag nyid gzhan du 'jug par 'gyur na don ma yin pa la don yin @145a * //
translated: The obscurations of the passions and the knowable are the causes.

original: no zhes sems phyin ci log tu 'byung bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: no zhes sems phyin ci log tu 'byung bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: The basis is the causal nature. If these very things were to function in another way, the mind would not arise in error, thinking that what is not the good is the good.

original: de med pas kyang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa de mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de med pas kyang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa de mi 'byung ngo //
translated: And because of the absence of that, the defilement of the obscurations of the passions and the defilement of the obscurations of the knowable would not arise.

original: don 'di dag nyid tshigs su bcad pas bstan pa ni /
analyzed: don 'di dag nyid tshigs su bcad pas bstan pa ni /
translated: These very things are indicated by the verse:

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu dang 'khrul pa ni rim pa bzhin du gzugs kyi rnam par rig pa dang / rnam rig gzugs can min par 'dod //üîΩces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu dang 'khrul pa ni rim pa bzhin du gzugs kyi rnam par rig pa dang / rnam rig gzugs can min par 'dod //üîΩces bya ba'o //
translated: The cause of error and error itself are considered to be the perception of form and the non-formal perception.

original: de la gzugs can gyi rnam par rig pa ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs can gyi rnam par rig pa ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The form of representation is the cause of error.

original: rgyur gyur pa'i gzugs can gyi rnam par rig pa med na 'bras bur gyur pa'i rnam par rig pa gzugs can ma yin pa gang yin pa yang mi 'byung bas ji ltar na lus dang longs spyod thams cad yod par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa'i gzugs can gyi rnam par rig pa med na 'bras bur gyur pa'i rnam par rig pa gzugs can ma yin pa gang yin pa yang mi 'byung bas ji ltar na lus dang longs spyod thams cad yod par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the form of representation that is the cause does not exist, then the representation that is the result, which is not form, would not occur. How then could all bodies and enjoyments exist?

original: lus dang lus can dang zab por rnam par rig pa gsum rnam par rig pa lus thams cad la lhan cig 'byung zhing zhes bya ba ni dus gcig tu 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: lus dang lus can dang zab por rnam par rig pa gsum rnam par rig pa lus thams cad la lhan cig 'byung zhing zhes bya ba ni dus gcig tu 'byung ba'o //
translated: The three representations of body, embodied being, and enjoyer arise simultaneously in all bodies of representation means that they occur at the same time.

original: nye bar spyod pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: nye bar spyod pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i ngo bo ste /
translated: Enjoyer is the nature of the cause.

original: rnam pa gsum char rnam par rig pa tsam du tshigs su bcad pa dang / rkyang pas rnam par 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum char rnam par rig pa tsam du tshigs su bcad pa dang / rkyang pas rnam par 'jog par byed do //
translated: The three verses and the prose passages set forth the three representations as mere representation.

original: de rkyang pa ni tsam du zas pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de rkyang pa ni tsam du zas pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The prose passage is mere representation.

original: thams cad rnam par rig pa tsam ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir de rnyed ni rnam par rig pa tsam mo //
analyzed: thams cad rnam par rig pa tsam ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir de rnyed ni rnam par rig pa tsam mo //
translated: Since everything is representation-only, it is representation-only.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam pa yin gyi don ni med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam pa yin gyi don ni med do //
translated: Therefore, it is representation-only, but there is no object.

original: yang rnam pa gnyis nyid ni rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa dang / lta ba can gyi rnam par shes pas rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis nyid ni rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa dang / lta ba can gyi rnam par shes pas rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, the twofold aspect is established by the consciousness that has an objective cause and by the consciousness that has a view.

original: gal te rnam par rig pa tsam gcig po de'i cha gcig ni rgyu mtshan yin la /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rig pa tsam gcig po de'i cha gcig ni rgyu mtshan yin la /
translated: If one part of that representation-only is the objective cause,

original: gnyis pa ni lta bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni lta bar 'gyur na /
translated: and the second part is the view,

original: des na yang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams gnyis nyid de /
analyzed: des na yang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams gnyis nyid de /
translated: then the eye consciousness and so on are twofold.

original: sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid du rnam par bzhag pas yang rnam par rig pa tsam gcig po de nyid la ji ltar rigs pa cha gcig ni sna tshogs su 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid du rnam par bzhag pas yang rnam par rig pa tsam gcig po de nyid la ji ltar rigs pa cha gcig ni sna tshogs su 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Since they are established as having a manifold nature, how is it that one representation-only has two parts that arise as a manifold?

original: gnyis pas ni 'di ltar 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni 'di ltar 'dzin par byed do //
translated: The second part apprehends it in that way.

original: yang gang gi phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'dzin par byed pa des na mig la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa chos kyi mthar thug pa thams cad ni rgyu mtshan yin pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni 'di ltar lta ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang gang gi phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'dzin par byed pa des na mig la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa chos kyi mthar thug pa thams cad ni rgyu mtshan yin pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni 'di ltar lta ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Moreover, because the mental consciousness apprehends, all the representations of eye, etc., up to the dharmas are the objective supports. Thus, the mental consciousness is called the viewer.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de dag nyid ni rgyu zhes bya bar yang bstan te so sor nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de dag nyid ni rgyu zhes bya bar yang bstan te so sor nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those very mental consciousnesses are also taught as the cause, because they are not individually determined.

original: yang gzhan @145b dag ni yul so sor nges pa yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: yang gzhan @145b dag ni yul so sor nges pa yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid de /
translated: Moreover, the others are individually determined with respect to their objects, and they are non-conceptual.

original: des na gang rnam par rtog pa can de ni lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na gang rnam par rtog pa can de ni lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that which is conceptual is called the viewer.

original: de ltar na 'di ni rnam par rig pa tsam du rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni rnam par rig pa tsam du rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Thus, this is the establishment of representation-only.

original: tshigs su bcad pa de tsam ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa de tsam ste /
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: don med pa la 'jug pa nyid de /
analyzed: don med pa la 'jug pa nyid de /
translated: It is the engagement with the unreal.

original: de tsam gnyis dang ste rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa dang / lta ba can gyi rnam par rig pa tsam mo //üîΩsna tshogs nyid 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de tsam gnyis dang ste rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa dang / lta ba can gyi rnam par rig pa tsam mo // sna tshogs nyid 'jug pa ste /
translated: The two kinds of suchness and the reason for it are the mere representations of the view.üîΩThe engagement in variety is

original: gang sna tshogs kyi rnam pa can nyid du 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa de'i'o //
analyzed: gang sna tshogs kyi rnam pa can nyid du 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa de'i'o //
translated: the engagement in the variety of aspects.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams rtogs par 'dod //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams rtogs par 'dod //
translated: The yogis and yoginis are said to realize it.

original: ces bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams 'di ltar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams 'di ltar 'dod pa'o //
translated: This is what the Yogacaras believe.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: sems tsam la ni zhugs gyur pa //üîΩde dang bral na de phyir yang //
analyzed: sems tsam la ni zhugs gyur pa // de dang bral na de phyir yang //
translated: They enter into mind only.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: When they are free from that, they are also free from this.

original: 'di ltar yang sems tsam la zhugs pas don med pa bral bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang sems tsam la zhugs pas don med pa bral bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by entering into mind only, they are free from the nonexistence of objects.

original: yang gal te gzung ba'i don med na sems kyis gang la 'dzin par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang gal te gzung ba'i don med na sems kyis gang la 'dzin par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if objects do not exist, what do the minds apprehend?

original: de tsam nyid dang / gnyis nyid dang / sna tshogs nyid la zhugs par gyur na /
analyzed: de tsam nyid dang / gnyis nyid dang / sna tshogs nyid la zhugs par gyur na /
translated: When they enter into mere representation, duality, and variety,

original: rgyu tsam du bstan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: rgyu tsam du bstan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: they enter into the cause alone.

original: gzhan dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: gzhan dang mtshungs so //
translated: It is the same for others.

original: byang chub sems dpa' kha cig ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig pu nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kha cig ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig pu nyid du 'dod do //
translated: Some bodhisattvas assert that there is only one mental consciousness.

original: gang yang de'i rim pa rnam par gzhag pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: gang yang de'i rim pa rnam par gzhag pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: We will now explain the order of the six consciousnesses.

original: de la sems pa la lus dang ngag gi las zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la /üîΩji ltar sems pa lus kyi sgo nas zhugs par gyur pa na lus kyi las zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la sems pa la lus dang ngag gi las zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la / ji ltar sems pa lus kyi sgo nas zhugs par gyur pa na lus kyi las zhes bya ba la /
translated: Just as intention is called bodily or vocal action,üîΩso too is consciousness called eye, etc.

original: ngag gi sgo nas ni ngag gi las zhes bya /
analyzed: ngag gi sgo nas ni ngag gi las zhes bya /
translated: Just as intention, when it occurs through the body, is called bodily action, and when it occurs through speech, is called vocal action,üîΩso too is consciousness called eye consciousness, etc.,

original: yid kyi las ni yid kyi las zhes bya ba thob pa bzhin du yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig pu yin na yang mig la brten nas 'jug pa na de mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob la /üîΩde bzhin du lus kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyi ming 'thob kyi /
analyzed: yid kyi las ni yid kyi las zhes bya ba thob pa bzhin du yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig pu yin na yang mig la brten nas 'jug pa na de mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob la /üîΩde bzhin du lus kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyi ming 'thob kyi /
translated: even though it is only mental consciousness, because it occurs in dependence on the eye, etc.

original: yang de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma yin pa rnam par shes pa gzhan kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba lta bu ni med do //
analyzed: yang de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma yin pa rnam par shes pa gzhan kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba lta bu ni med do //
translated: Moreover, there is no other consciousness, such as the so-called store-consciousness, which is not the mental consciousness.

original: de ltar na rten thams cad du 'byung ba na gang gi sna tshogs kyi rnam pa gnyis su snang bas byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na rten thams cad du 'byung ba na gang gi sna tshogs kyi rnam pa gnyis su snang bas byung ste /
translated: Thus, when it occurs in all the supports, it is the origin of the appearance of the two aspects of the manifold.

original: de don tsam du snang ba dang / rnam par rtog par snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di dag gis yongs su spongs ngo //
analyzed: de don tsam du snang ba dang / rnam par rtog par snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di dag gis yongs su spongs ngo //
translated: This is to be understood by the words: ‚Äúbecause of the appearance as mere object and the appearance as representation.‚Äù

original: de la rten thams cad du zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rten thams cad du'o //
analyzed: de la rten thams cad du zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rten thams cad du'o //
translated: Therein, ‚Äúin all the supports‚Äù means in all the supports such as the eye.

original: @146a * // sna tshogs kyi rnam pa gnyis su snang ba zhes bya ba ni de don tsam du snang ba dang / rnam par rtog par snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis kyis ston par byed do //
analyzed: @146a * // sna tshogs kyi rnam pa gnyis su snang ba zhes bya ba ni de don tsam du snang ba dang / rnam par rtog par snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis kyis ston par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe appearance of the manifold in two aspects‚Äù is taught by the two words: ‚Äúbecause of the appearance as mere object and the appearance as representation.‚Äù

original: gang tshig gnyis po 'dis ni rnam par shes pa gcig po de nyid kyi cha gcig ni don tsam du snang bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang tshig gnyis po 'dis ni rnam par shes pa gcig po de nyid kyi cha gcig ni don tsam du snang bar 'gyur la /
translated: The first two lines of this verse show that the one consciousness itself appears as just the object-form, etc.

original: yang de gnyis pa ni don gyi rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang de gnyis pa ni don gyi rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa 'byung ste /
translated: The second two lines show that the second part of that consciousness arises in the aspect of the concept of the object.

original: des na sngar smras pa'i skyon med do //
analyzed: des na sngar smras pa'i skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, the previously stated error does not occur.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs yod na thams cad du reg bya'i snang ba 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs yod na thams cad du reg bya'i snang ba 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because when form exists, the appearance of tactile objects occurs everywhere.

original: gang gi phyir mnyam par gzhag pa na rnam par shes pa lnga ni nye ba ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mnyam par gzhag pa na rnam par shes pa lnga ni nye ba ma yin la /
translated: Because when one is in equipoise, the five consciousnesses are not present,üîΩbut the internal experience occurs.

original: nang gi nyams su myong ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur te de las gzhan pa'i dbang po gzugs can lus la gnas pa bzhin du bya ba ste /
analyzed: nang gi nyams su myong ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur te de las gzhan pa'i dbang po gzugs can lus la gnas pa bzhin du bya ba ste /
translated: Just as the other physical sense faculties are located in the body,

original: de ji ltar lus la gnas pa'i dbang po mig la sogs pa gzhan rnams lus de la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir /üîΩdbang po'i rang gi gnas nyid de la des byas pa'i phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa nye bar sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de ji ltar lus la gnas pa'i dbang po mig la sogs pa gzhan rnams lus de la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir /üîΩdbang po'i rang gi gnas nyid de la des byas pa'i phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa nye bar sgrub par byed do //
translated: so too the mental faculty is located in the body, because the other physical sense faculties such as the eyes are located in that body.üîΩJust as the physical sense faculties such as the eyes are located in the body, the mental faculty is located in the body, because the other physical sense faculties such as the eyes are located in that body.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni lus la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir lus 'gyur bar byed par 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni lus la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir lus 'gyur bar byed par 'dod par bya'o //
translated: So too, here, since mental consciousness is based on the body, it should be asserted that it causes the body to change.

original: don gzhan yang ji ltar lus kyi dbang po rnams lus la brten pa nyid na phyir rol gyi rkyen reg par bya ba yod na lus kyi dbang po la yang reg bya'i snang ba 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: don gzhan yang ji ltar lus kyi dbang po rnams lus la brten pa nyid na phyir rol gyi rkyen reg par bya ba yod na lus kyi dbang po la yang reg bya'i snang ba 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, just as the body faculty is based on the body, when external conditions that are tangible objects exist, the body faculty also produces the appearance of tangible objects.

original: de byung bar gyur pa na rang gi rten lus la phan 'dogs pa'am /üîΩgnod par 'gyur bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de byung bar gyur pa na rang gi rten lus la phan 'dogs pa'am / gnod par 'gyur bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: When that occurs, it benefits or harms its basis, the body.

original: de bzhin du yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang lus la brten pa yin pa'i phyir reg bya'i snang ba byung nas lus la phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang lus la brten pa yin pa'i phyir reg bya'i snang ba byung nas lus la phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa sgrub par byed do //
translated: So too, since mental consciousness is based on the body, when the appearance of tangible objects occurs, it benefits or harms the body.

original: 'di dag gi lus ni gal te mig la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa med pa de la brten pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'jug pa yang rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di dag gi lus ni gal te mig la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa med pa de la brten pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'jug pa yang rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid thob par 'gyur te /
translated: If their bodies were not conceptualized, the mental consciousness that is based on the eye, etc. would also be non-conceptual.

original: ji ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kun nas nyon mongs pa la brten nas nyon mongs pa can du 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kun nas nyon mongs pa la brten nas nyon mongs pa can du 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as the afflicted consciousness arises in dependence on the afflicted store-consciousness.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa' tshigs su bcad pas bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa' tshigs su bcad pas bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa la /
translated: This is also stated in verse for the sake of the bodhisattvas.

original: ring du 'gro zhes bya ba ni yul thams cad la dmigs pa can nyid kyis so //
analyzed: ring du 'gro zhes bya ba ni yul thams cad la dmigs pa can nyid kyis so //
translated: It goes far means that it has as its object all the objects.

original: gcig pu rgyu ba ni gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig pu rgyu ba ni gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It moves alone means that it has no companion.

original: gang zhig lus med ces bya ba ni lus dang bral @146b ba nyid do //
analyzed: gang zhig lus med ces bya ba ni lus dang bral @146b ba nyid do //
translated: It is bodiless means that it is free from a body.

original: phug gnas zhes bya ba ni lus kyi phug gi nang na gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: phug gnas zhes bya ba ni lus kyi phug gi nang na gnas pa nyid do //
translated: It dwells in a cave means that it dwells in the interior of the body.

original: sems 'dul byed ces bya ba ni dbang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems 'dul byed ces bya ba ni dbang du byed pa'o //
translated: It controls the mind means that it dominates the mind.

original: gdul bar dka' ba zhes bya ba ni bcos dka' ba'o //
analyzed: gdul bar dka' ba zhes bya ba ni bcos dka' ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDifficult to subdue‚Äù means difficult to remedy.

original: yang lung ni 'di dag gi spyod yul gyi yul ni yid kyis so sor nyams su myong ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang lung ni 'di dag gi spyod yul gyi yul ni yid kyis so sor nyams su myong ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, the scriptures state: ‚ÄúThe objects of these are experienced by the mental faculty individually.‚Äù

original: gang dbang po'i spyod yul du bstan pa'i yul de ni yid kyis re re zhing so so so sor nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dbang po'i spyod yul du bstan pa'i yul de ni yid kyis re re zhing so so so sor nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: The objects that are taught to be the objects of the sense faculties are experienced individually by the mental faculty.

original: chos thams cad la rnam par rtog pa can yin pa'i phyir so sor nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la rnam par rtog pa can yin pa'i phyir so sor nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: They are experienced individually because the mental faculty has concepts with regard to all phenomena.

original: yid ni 'di dag gi rten pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid ni 'di dag gi rten pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe mental faculty is their support.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir yid g-yeng bar gyur na de dag 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas dbang po de dag 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yid g-yeng bar gyur na de dag 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas dbang po de dag 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when the mental faculty is distracted, they do not arise, it is the cause of the arising of the sense faculties.

original: yang lung gis ni rnam par nges pa'i tshogs drug ni yid ces bya ba'i sgras bstan gyi rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi sgras ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yang lung gis ni rnam par nges pa'i tshogs drug ni yid ces bya ba'i sgras bstan gyi rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi sgras ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the scriptures teach that the six collections of consciousness are indicated by the word ‚Äúmental faculty‚Äù and not by the word ‚Äúconsciousness.‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni yid kyi skye mched do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni yid kyi skye mched do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The six collections of consciousness are the mind base.

original: des na yid 'ba' zhig ni yod do zhes 'di ltar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: des na yid 'ba' zhig ni yod do zhes 'di ltar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should understand that only the mind exists.

original: mtshan ma'i lta ba dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam par gzhag par bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i lta ba dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam par gzhag par bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The consciousness that is posited as having the view of signs is the store consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa ni lta ba'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa ni lta ba'o //
translated: The view is the mental consciousness together with the store consciousness.

original: mig la sogs pa rnam par reg pa ni rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnam par reg pa ni rgyu mtshan no //
translated: The eye and so on that are the conditions are the causal condition.

original: de ni chos thams cad kyang yin la rnam par rig pa tsam yang yin pas rnam par rig pa rgyu mtshan du gyur pa de dag nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ni chos thams cad kyang yin la rnam par rig pa tsam yang yin pas rnam par rig pa rgyu mtshan du gyur pa de dag nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: Since it is both all phenomena and mere representation, it is called the representation that is the causal condition.

original: mig la sogs pa 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa ni dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa ni dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The causal condition that is the cause of the arising of the eye and so on is the objective nature.

original: de'i lta ba 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de nyid lta ba yin pa ni de'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: de'i lta ba 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de nyid lta ba yin pa ni de'i lta ba'o //
translated: The reason for its being a view is that it is the cause of the arising of a view.

original: de lta ba nyid du snang bar gyur pa na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i lta ba rgyun mi 'chad par gnas pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir rten gyi bya ba byed do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de lta ba nyid du snang bar gyur pa na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i lta ba rgyun mi 'chad par gnas pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir rten gyi bya ba byed do zhes brjod do //
translated: When it appears as a view, it is said to perform the function of a basis, because it is the cause for the uninterrupted continuance of the view that is the mental consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa mi mthun pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid shes pas ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mi mthun pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid shes pas ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The reason for its being knowledge is that it is the sign of consciousness that is not in accord with reality.

original: rnam par shes pa mi mthun pa rnams kyi rgyu mtshan ni don yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mi mthun pa rnams kyi rgyu mtshan ni don yin no //
translated: The sign of consciousnesses that are not in accord with reality is an object.

original: shes par byed pas na shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes par byed pas na shes pa'o //
translated: It is knowledge because it causes one to know.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i rnam par rig pa dmigs pas zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med par yang rnam par shes pa 'byung ba ni lta ba ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i rnam par rig pa dmigs pas zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med par yang rnam par shes pa 'byung ba ni lta ba ste /
translated: The reason for its being an object is that consciousness arises in the absence of an object.

original: dper na 'das pa la sogs pa dmigs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'das pa la sogs pa dmigs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the object of the past, etc.

original: 'bad pa med par yang phyin ci log med par thal bar 'gyur te 'di ltar shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'bad pa med par yang phyin ci log med par thal bar 'gyur te 'di ltar shes pa'o //
translated: If it were the cause of consciousness, it would follow, absurdly, that consciousness would arise without effort and without error.

original: @147a * // shes pa rnam pa gsum gyi rjes su mthun par shes pas ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @147a * // shes pa rnam pa gsum gyi rjes su mthun par shes pas ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: By knowing in accordance with the three kinds of knowledge.

original: gang gi phyir don ni 'di ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don ni 'di ltar 'gyur te /
translated: The meaning is as follows:

original: ji ltar snang ba de med par yang gnyen po 'byung bar 'gyur bas phyin ci log med par thal bar 'gyur te 'di ltar shes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba de med par yang gnyen po 'byung bar 'gyur bas phyin ci log med par thal bar 'gyur te 'di ltar shes pa'o //
translated: Since the remedy arises even in the absence of the appearance of the object, the consequence is that there is no error.

original: shes pa rnam pa gsum gyi rjes su mthun par shes pas zhes bya ba ni don de shes pas rnam pa gsum gyi rjes su mthun par shes zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa rnam pa gsum gyi rjes su mthun par shes pas zhes bya ba ni don de shes pas rnam pa gsum gyi rjes su mthun par shes zhes bya ba'o //
translated: By knowing in accordance with the three kinds of knowledge means by knowing that object in accordance with the three kinds of knowledge.

original: bsam gtan pa zhes bya ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: bsam gtan pa zhes bya ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams so //
translated: The meditators, the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, means the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: sems la dbang thob pas zhes bya ba ni sems las su rung ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: sems la dbang thob pas zhes bya ba ni sems las su rung ba thob pa'o //
translated: By attaining mastery over mind means by attaining mental fitness.

original: mos pa'i dbang gis de ltar don de dag snang ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mos pa'i dbang gis de ltar don de dag snang ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: By the power of resolve, those objects appear in that way.

original: gal te sa'i rang bzhin du mos nas yang de bzhin du 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te sa'i rang bzhin du mos nas yang de bzhin du 'gyur la /
translated: If one is devoted to the nature of earth, it will be just so.

original: de bzhin du me la sogs pa la yang don de bzhin du blta'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du me la sogs pa la yang don de bzhin du blta'o //
translated: And so on in the same way for fire, etc.

original: zhi gnas thob pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin thob pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas thob pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin thob pa'o //
translated: One who has attained serenity is one who has attained concentration.

original: chos la lhag mthong la brtson pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni mdo sde la sogs pa la spyod pa la brtson pa rnams so //
analyzed: chos la lhag mthong la brtson pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni mdo sde la sogs pa la spyod pa la brtson pa rnams so //
translated: Those who are devoted to insight into things are those who are devoted to the practice of the s≈´tras, etc.

original: yid la byed pa tsam du don snang ba zhes bya ba ni don gcig la yang ji lta ji ltar yid la byas pa de lta de ltar rnam pa mang po snang ba'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa tsam du don snang ba zhes bya ba ni don gcig la yang ji lta ji ltar yid la byas pa de lta de ltar rnam pa mang po snang ba'o //
translated: The meaning appears as mere mental activity means that the same object appears in many aspects, just as it is mentally constructed.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: One who has attained nonconceptual intuition means that

original: drug po la snang ba'i don ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa yin na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: drug po la snang ba'i don ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa yin na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: if the meaning that appears in the six sense consciousnesses exists just as it appears, then nonconceptual intuition would not exist.

original: de lta na yang de yod pa'i dus na yang don gyi ngo bo nyid med pa ni nges par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang de yod pa'i dus na yang don gyi ngo bo nyid med pa ni nges par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Nevertheless, it must definitely be accepted that even when it exists, the entity of the object does not exist.

original: gal te rnam par rig pa tsam don snang ba'i gnas zhes bya ba ni don med bzhin du yang rnam par rig pa nyid don du snang ba'i rgyu yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te rnam par rig pa tsam don snang ba'i gnas zhes bya ba ni don med bzhin du yang rnam par rig pa nyid don du snang ba'i rgyu yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the so-called ‚Äúbasis of the appearance of objects in consciousness‚Äù is the cause of the appearance of objects in consciousness, even in the absence of objects, then consciousness itself is the cause of the appearance of objects.

original: gal te rnam par rig pa tsam gzhan gyi dbang yin na de ji ltar gzhan gyi dbang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rig pa tsam gzhan gyi dbang yin na de ji ltar gzhan gyi dbang yin zhe na /
translated: If consciousness-only is dependent on something else, how is it dependent on something else?

original: rang nyid gzung bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rang nyid gzung bar bya ba yin te /
translated: It is dependent on something else because it is itself the object of apprehension.

original: rgyu des na gzhan gyi dbang yin la /
analyzed: rgyu des na gzhan gyi dbang yin la /
translated: For that reason, it is dependent on something else.

original: gzhan zhes brjod na ni rang gi rgyu las byung zhing byung ba nyid na gnas par mi rung ba dang / rang nyid kyis 'dzin pas gzhan zhes bya ba'i gzhan dbang yin no //
analyzed: gzhan zhes brjod na ni rang gi rgyu las byung zhing byung ba nyid na gnas par mi rung ba dang / rang nyid kyis 'dzin pas gzhan zhes bya ba'i gzhan dbang yin no //
translated: If it is called ‚Äúother,‚Äù it is dependent on something else because it arises from its own cause and, having arisen, it is not suitable to remain by itself and it is apprehended by something else.

original: de la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i gzhan gyi dbang rnam par rig pa tsam la brten pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i gzhan gyi dbang rnam par rig pa tsam la brten pa'o //
translated: In this context, ‚Äúbasis‚Äù means the other-dependent pattern that is the basis of consciousness-only.

original: don med pa zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don med pa zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúNonexistent‚Äù means ‚Äúnot existing.‚Äù

original: snang ba zhes bya ba ni don du dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba zhes bya ba ni don du dmigs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAppearance‚Äù means the apprehension of an object.

original: de ji ltar @147b na zhes bya ba dang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba dag ni ji ltar bshad ma thag pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ji ltar @147b na zhes bya ba dang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba dag ni ji ltar bshad ma thag pa lta bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHow?‚Äù and ‚Äúwhy?‚Äù are as already explained.

original: dpag tu med pa'i rnam pa can gyi zhes bya ba ni yul thams cad la dmigs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa'i rnam pa can gyi zhes bya ba ni yul thams cad la dmigs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving an immeasurable aspect‚Äù means the mental consciousness that has all objects as its domain.

original: kun tu rtog pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas kun tu brtags pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas kun tu brtags pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúImagination‚Äù means the mental consciousness that imagines.

original: phyin ci log 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis don phyin ci log skye ba'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyin ci log 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis don phyin ci log skye ba'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cause of the arising of error‚Äù means that it is the cause of the arising of the error of the object by the nature of its being the objective support.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid med ces bya ba ni de'i lus med pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid med ces bya ba ni de'i lus med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout a specific identity‚Äù means that it does not have that body.

original: kun tu rtog pa tsam du dmigs pas zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa'i rnam par shes pa tsam la dmigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa tsam du dmigs pas zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa'i rnam par shes pa tsam la dmigs pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is apprehended as mere imagination‚Äù means that it is apprehended as mere erroneous consciousness.

original: de gtan med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de gtan med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of complete non-existence is the reality of the insubstantiality of the imagined nature.

original: de ji ltar na zhes bya ba dang / ci'i phyir na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de ji ltar na zhes bya ba dang / ci'i phyir na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: How is it? and Why is it? are the other-dependent nature as it is.

original: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni slu ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni slu ba med pa nyid do //
translated: Because it does not change into something else is the non-deceptive nature.

original: slu ba med pa'i 'khor bzhin no //
analyzed: slu ba med pa'i 'khor bzhin no //
translated: It is like a non-deceptive circle.

original: rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa yin pa dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa'i ngo bo ni yongs su grub pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa yin pa dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa'i ngo bo ni yongs su grub pa yin te /
translated: Because it is the object of purification and because it is the supreme of all virtuous things is the perfected nature, which is the reality of the object of purification.

original: mchog yin pa'i phyir yongs su rdzogs pa'i gnas bzhin no //
analyzed: mchog yin pa'i phyir yongs su rdzogs pa'i gnas bzhin no //
translated: Because it is supreme, it is like the supreme abode.

original: kun tu rtog pas ji ltar kun du rtog ces bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni kun tu rtog pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kun tu rtog pas ji ltar kun du rtog ces bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni kun tu rtog pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: How is it imagined by imagination? is the mental consciousness, which is called imagination.

original: de la ni gzhan gyi dbang la kun tu rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de la ni gzhan gyi dbang la kun tu rtog pa ste /
translated: In that, the other-dependent nature is imagined.

original: rnam pa gang gis kun tu rtog pa de ston par byed pa de ni ming gis dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung yin te /üîΩgzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la der mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis kun tu rtog pa de ston par byed pa de ni ming gis dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung yin te / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la der mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The text ‚ÄúThe apprehension of the objective referent by way of name, etc.‚Äù shows the mode of imagination.üîΩ‚ÄúThe apprehension of the objective referent by way of name, etc.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi dbang nyid la mig la sogs pa'i ming gi mtshan mar 'dzin pas gang gi phyir mtshan ma bzung nas kun tu rtog go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang nyid la mig la sogs pa'i ming gi mtshan mar 'dzin pas gang gi phyir mtshan ma bzung nas kun tu rtog go //
translated: means that one apprehends the objective referent as the name, etc. of the dependent nature, such as ‚Äúeye,‚Äù etc. and then imagines it on the basis of that apprehension of the objective referent.

original: lta bas de la mngon par zhen pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'di ni 'di lta bu'o zhes mtshan mas mtshan ma nyid du bzung nas zhen pa'o //
analyzed: lta bas de la mngon par zhen pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'di ni 'di lta bu'o zhes mtshan mas mtshan ma nyid du bzung nas zhen pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe adherence to that by way of view‚Äù means that one adheres to the objective referent as the objective referent on the basis of apprehending the objective referent as the name, etc.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis ngag kun nas slong ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis ngag kun nas slong ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe generation of speech by way of imagination‚Äù means that one generates speech on the basis of the three types of imagination.

original: ji ltar mngon par zhen pas mi gnod pa yin na yang rnam par rtog pa gsum gyis nga kun nas 'byung bar byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par zhen pas mi gnod pa yin na yang rnam par rtog pa gsum gyis nga kun nas 'byung bar byed do //
translated: Even though one does not adhere to the objective referent as it is apprehended, one generates speech on the basis of the three types of imagination.

original: mthong ba la sogs pa tha snyad bzhi po dag gis tha snyad 'dogs pa zhes bya ba la ni ji ltar mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha snyad rnam pa bzhis gzhan dang @148a * //
analyzed: mthong ba la sogs pa tha snyad bzhi po dag gis tha snyad 'dogs pa zhes bya ba la ni ji ltar mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha snyad rnam pa bzhis gzhan dang @148a * //
translated: The four conventional expressions such as seeing are called conventional expressions because they are conventional expressions that are made by means of the four kinds of conventional expressions such as seeing, hearing, knowing, and discerning.

original: tha snyad du byed pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad du byed pa'o //
translated: The conventional expressions are made by means of these four kinds of conventional expressions.

original: med pa'i don la yod pa zhes sgro 'dogs pas zhes bya ba ni tha snyad ji lta ba bzhin du med pa'i don la don yod pa nyid do zhes bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i don la yod pa zhes sgro 'dogs pas zhes bya ba ni tha snyad ji lta ba bzhin du med pa'i don la don yod pa nyid do zhes bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of non-existence is grasped as existent because the meaning that is not as it is conventionally expressed is grasped as having an existent reality.

original: kun tu rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba ni kun tu rtog pa zhes bya ba nyid kyi rnam par shes pas kun tu brtags pa zhes bya ba'i mtshan mar bzung nas dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid du skye'o //
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba ni kun tu rtog pa zhes bya ba nyid kyi rnam par shes pas kun tu brtags pa zhes bya ba'i mtshan mar bzung nas dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid du skye'o //
translated: The sign of imagination is the object that is imagined by the consciousness that is called imagination, and is grasped as a sign that is imagined. It arises as the nature of an object that is imagined.

original: des kun nas brtags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun tu rtog pa zhes bya ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa des kun tu brtags pa zhes bya bas dmigs par 'gyur ba'i mtshan mas bzung nas kun tu rtog par byed pas don des na gzhan gyi
analyzed: des kun nas brtags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun tu rtog pa zhes bya ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa des kun tu brtags pa zhes bya bas dmigs par 'gyur ba'i mtshan mas bzung nas kun tu rtog par byed pas don des na gzhan gyi
translated: Because it is imagined. The imagination is the mental consciousness. It is imagined because it is apprehended by the signs that are imagined by the mental consciousness. It is imagined because it imagines by apprehending the object through the signs that are imagined.

original: dbang la kun tu brtags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang la kun tu brtags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the other-dependent is called imagined.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa kun tu rtog pas kun tu brtags pa nyid kyis kun tu brtags pa ji ltar kun tu brtags pa de bzhin du de gtan med pas 'di ltar don des na gzhan gyi dbang de nyid yongs su grub par zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa kun tu rtog pas kun tu brtags pa nyid kyis kun tu brtags pa ji ltar kun tu brtags pa de bzhin du de gtan med pas 'di ltar don des na gzhan gyi dbang de nyid yongs su grub par zhes bya'o //
translated: The imagined is imagined by the imagination of the mental consciousness. It is imagined because it is imagined by the imagination of the mental consciousness. It is just as imagined, because it is completely non-existent. Therefore, the other-dependent is called the perfected.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub pa gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de lta bu'i gzhan gyi dbang de rnam par rtog par gyur na kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub pa gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de lta bu'i gzhan gyi dbang de rnam par rtog par gyur na kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur la /
translated: The other-dependent is the nature of both defilement and purification because the other-dependent is defiled when it becomes imagination,

original: rnam par mi rtog par gyur na rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog par gyur na rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When there is non-imagination, there is purification.

original: de dag gnyi ga'i sgra gcig tu zhugs par gyur pa ni ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga'i sgra gcig tu zhugs par gyur pa ni ma grub pa yin no //
translated: The inclusion of both of these in the single term ‚Äúimagination‚Äù is not established.

original: ngo bo nyid du kun tu rtog pa dang / khyad par du kun tu rtog pa zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du kun tu rtog pa dang / khyad par du kun tu rtog pa zhes bya ba de la /
translated: Imagination of the nature of an entity and imagination of the distinctions of an entity.üîΩImagination of the nature of an entity is the imagination of the nature of an entity such as the eye, etc.üîΩImagination of the distinctions of an entity is the imagination of the distinctions of those very entities by way of the distinctions of non-eternality, etc.

original: ngo bo nyid du kun tu rtog pa ni ji ltar mig la sogs pa rnams la mig gi ngo bo la sogs pa kun tu rtog pa'o //üîΩkhyad par du kun tu rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
