original: nor pa nyid la som nyi za ba la gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de sgyu ma'i dpes ston /üîΩpar mdzad de /
analyzed: nor pa nyid la som nyi za ba la gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de sgyu ma'i dpes ston / par mdzad de /
translated: The reality of the other-dependent is taught by the example of an illusion for those who doubt the error itself.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma'i glang po dang / rta don du med na yang yul du 'gyur ba de bzhin du don yang blta bar bya'o zhes de'i som nyi bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma'i glang po dang / rta don du med na yang yul du 'gyur ba de bzhin du don yang blta bar bya'o zhes de'i som nyi bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as an illusory elephant or horse, though nonexistent as an object, is an object, so too should one view the object.

original: gzhan yang sems dang sems las byung ba don med pa rnams dmigs pa med par ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur snyam du som nyi za bar 'gyur bas de'i gnyen por smig rgyu ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems dang sems las byung ba don med pa rnams dmigs pa med par ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur snyam du som nyi za bar 'gyur bas de'i gnyen por smig rgyu ste /
translated: Moreover, one might doubt how the mind and mental factors, which are meaningless, arise without an object.üîΩThe antidote to that is the mirage.

original: de la smig rgyu'i gnas lta bu ni sems dang sems las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la smig rgyu'i gnas lta bu ni sems dang sems las byung ba'o //
translated: The mind and mental factors are like the place of the mirage.

original: chu'i gnas lta bu ni don to //
analyzed: chu'i gnas lta bu ni don to //
translated: The object is like the place of water.

original: des na ji ltar smig rgyu rgyu bar gyur pa na chu'i don med bzhin du yang chu'i don gyi blo skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: des na ji ltar smig rgyu rgyu bar gyur pa na chu'i don med bzhin du yang chu'i don gyi blo skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, just as a mirage, when moving, produces the idea of the object water, though water does not exist there,

original: de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu bar gyur pa na yang yod pa ma yin pa'i don gyi blo 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu bar gyur pa na yang yod pa ma yin pa'i don gyi blo 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, when the mind and mental factors are in motion, the mind arises in regard to a nonexistent object.

original: yang byis ba rnams ji ltar don med na 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i nye bar spyod pa ji ltar thob par 'gyur zhes som nyi za ba de bzlog par bya ba'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang ni rmi lam lta bu nyid de /
analyzed: yang byis ba rnams ji ltar don med na 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i nye bar spyod pa ji ltar thob par 'gyur zhes som nyi za ba de bzlog par bya ba'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang ni rmi lam lta bu nyid de /
translated: Again, in order to remove the doubt of the foolish who think, ‚ÄúIf the object does not exist, how can there be the attainment of the experience of the desirable and the undesirable?‚Äù it is said that the other-dependent nature is like a dream.

original: rmi lam na don ji lta ba bzhin du med na yang 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i nye bar spyad pa thob pa mthong ba bzhin du 'dir yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rmi lam na don ji lta ba bzhin du med na yang 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i nye bar spyad pa thob pa mthong ba bzhin du 'dir yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Just as in a dream, although the object does not exist as it is, the attainment of the experience of the desirable and the undesirable is seen, so it is here. This is how it should be understood.

original: yang don med na las dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa ji ltar mngon par 'gyur bar 'gyur snyam du som nyi za ba de bzlog pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan gyi dpes chos mthun pa'i gzhan gyi dbang bstan te /
analyzed: yang don med na las dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa ji ltar mngon par 'gyur bar 'gyur snyam du som nyi za ba de bzlog pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan gyi dpes chos mthun pa'i gzhan gyi dbang bstan te /
translated: To eliminate such doubts, the example of a reflection is taught as a concordant example of the dependent nature.

original: ji ltar gzugs kyi don med bzhin du yang gzugs brnyan la gzugs nyid kyi blo 'byung bar 'gyur na yang gzugs nyid kyi don yod pa ni ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'i don yod pa ma yin na yangüîΩde dmigs pa nyid @152a * //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs kyi don med bzhin du yang gzugs brnyan la gzugs nyid kyi blo 'byung bar 'gyur na yang gzugs nyid kyi don yod pa ni ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'i don yod pa ma yin na yang de dmigs pa nyid @152a * //
translated: Just as a reflection is a cognition of form that occurs in relation to a reflection, even though there is no object of form, and yet the object of form does not exist, in the same way, here, even though the objects of desirable and undesirable results do not exist,üîΩthey are still observed.

original: du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: du blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be understood.

original: yang don med na ji ltar rnam par shes pa sna tshogs 'byung bar 'gyur snyam du so ma nyi za ba de'i gnyen por gzhan gyi dbang dang chos mthun pa mig yor gyi dpes bstan te /
analyzed: yang don med na ji ltar rnam par shes pa sna tshogs 'byung bar 'gyur snyam du so ma nyi za ba de'i gnyen por gzhan gyi dbang dang chos mthun pa mig yor gyi dpes bstan te /
translated: If there is no object, how can various consciousnesses arise? To eliminate such doubts, the example of a mirage is taught as a concordant example of the dependent nature.

original: ji ltar grib ma'i rtsed mo 'dod pa'i dbang gis rnam pha sna tshogs su sgyur bar byed pa na de na mig yor gyi don med bzhin du yang rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba ni dmigs so //
analyzed: ji ltar grib ma'i rtsed mo 'dod pa'i dbang gis rnam pha sna tshogs su sgyur bar byed pa na de na mig yor gyi don med bzhin du yang rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba ni dmigs so //
translated: Just as when one is engaged in play with shadows, the various appearances are seen even though there is no object of the optical illusion.

original: de bzhin rnam par shes pa yang don rnam pa sna tshogs med na yang don rnam pa sna tshogs pa nyid du snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin rnam par shes pa yang don rnam pa sna tshogs med na yang don rnam pa sna tshogs pa nyid du snang ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, consciousness appears as various objects even though there are no various objects.

original: yang don med na ji ltar tha snyad brjod pa rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung bar 'gyur snyam du som nyi za ba de bzlog pa'i phyir brag ca lta bu nyid do zhes 'di ltar rnam par 'jog par byed de /
analyzed: yang don med na ji ltar tha snyad brjod pa rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung bar 'gyur snyam du som nyi za ba de bzlog pa'i phyir brag ca lta bu nyid do zhes 'di ltar rnam par 'jog par byed de /
translated: In order to eliminate the doubt that if there is no object, how can the various expressions of conventional usage occur, he posits the example of an echo:

original: 'di ltar don med bzhin du yang brag ca grag pa dmigs par 'gyur ba de bzhin du yang tha snyad brjod pa sna tshogs med bzhin du de nye bar dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar don med bzhin du yang brag ca grag pa dmigs par 'gyur ba de bzhin du yang tha snyad brjod pa sna tshogs med bzhin du de nye bar dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as an echo is perceived even though there is no sound, in the same way, the various expressions of conventional usage are perceived even though they do not exist.

original: yang don med na ji ltar mnyam par gzhag pa rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la 'jig rten pa'i don dmigs par 'gyur zhes bya ba dang / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes shing ji lta ba bzhin mthong ngo zhes 'di ltar 'byung ba de ji lta bu zhes som nyi za bas de'i gnyen por chos mthun pa chu zla'i dpes bstan te ;
analyzed: yang don med na ji ltar mnyam par gzhag pa rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la 'jig rten pa'i don dmigs par 'gyur zhes bya ba dang / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes shing ji lta ba bzhin mthong ngo zhes 'di ltar 'byung ba de ji lta bu zhes som nyi za bas de'i gnyen por chos mthun pa chu zla'i dpes bstan te ;
translated: And, ‚ÄúThe mind in meditative equipoise fully knows and sees reality just as it is.‚ÄùüîΩThe example of the moon in water is taught as a concordant example to remedy that doubt.

original: ji ltar chu la zla ba'i don med bzhin du yang rlan pa nyid dang / dang ba'i phyir chu la de nye bar dmigs pa bzhin du mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems la dmigs pa'i don med bzhin du yang de nye bar dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar chu la zla ba'i don med bzhin du yang rlan pa nyid dang / dang ba'i phyir chu la de nye bar dmigs pa bzhin du mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems la dmigs pa'i don med bzhin du yang de nye bar dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: Just as the object of the moon does not exist in the water, but because of its wetness and clarity, the moon is observed in the water, so too, although the object observed by the mind in meditative equipoise does not exist, it is observed.

original: 'dir yang chu zla lta bu ni rlan pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang chu zla lta bu ni rlan pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin yin no //
translated: Here, the moon in water is concentration because it has the nature of wetness.

original: yang ji ltar don med na sems can gyi bya ba bsgrub pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' de kho na nyid rtogs pa rnams sems can rnams kyi don gyi phyir blo sngon du btang nas 'gro ba de dang de dag tu bdag gi lus 'dzin par byed ces
analyzed: yang ji ltar don med na sems can gyi bya ba bsgrub pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' de kho na nyid rtogs pa rnams sems can rnams kyi don gyi phyir blo sngon du btang nas 'gro ba de dang de dag tu bdag gi lus 'dzin par byed ces
translated: Again, how is it that, since there is no purpose, the bodhisattvas who have realized thatness take on bodies in various realms in order to accomplish the activities of sentient beings, since they have previously set their minds on the goal of sentient beings?

original: som nyi za ba de'i gnyen por gzhan gyi dbang dang chos mthun pa sprul pa lta bus bstan te /üîΩji ltar sprul pa'i don med bzhin du yang sprul pa'i dbang gis dgos ba sgrub par byed pa na yang sprul pa'i don dmigs pa bzhin du bdag gi lus len pa'i don med bzhin du yang sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa po'i bdag gi lus len
analyzed: som nyi za ba de'i gnyen por gzhan gyi dbang dang chos mthun pa sprul pa lta bus bstan te / ji ltar sprul pa'i don med bzhin du yang sprul pa'i dbang gis dgos ba sgrub par byed pa na yang sprul pa'i don dmigs pa bzhin du bdag gi lus len pa'i don med bzhin du yang sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa po'i bdag gi lus len
translated: The antidote to such doubt is taught by the example of the emanation, which is similar to the dependent nature.

original: pa'i don nye bar dmigs par blta bar @152b bya'o ;
analyzed: pa'i don nye bar dmigs par blta bar @152b bya'o ;
translated: Just as an emanation, even though it has no purpose, accomplishes a purpose by the power of the emanation, in the same way, even though there is no purpose in taking on a body, one should see that the purpose of taking on a body is perceived, in order to benefit all sentient beings.

original: / bcom ldan 'das kyis don ci las dgongs nas yod pa ma yin pa'i sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dpe brgyad bstan ce na /
analyzed: / bcom ldan 'das kyis don ci las dgongs nas yod pa ma yin pa'i sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dpe brgyad bstan ce na /
translated: What was the intention of the Bhagavat when he taught the eight examples of illusion, such as the nonexistence of illusion?

original: de bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de bstan par bya'o //
translated: That will be taught.

original: de la re zhig sgyu ma'i dpe ni nang gi bdag nyid can gyi skye mched drug po mig la sogs pa rnams kyi gnyen po ste gang gi phyir sgyu ma'i glang po bzhin du de dag yod pa ma yin na yang nye bar dmigs pa nyid du blta
analyzed: de la re zhig sgyu ma'i dpe ni nang gi bdag nyid can gyi skye mched drug po mig la sogs pa rnams kyi gnyen po ste gang gi phyir sgyu ma'i glang po bzhin du de dag yod pa ma yin na yang nye bar dmigs pa nyid du blta
translated: Therein, the example of illusion is the antidote to the six sense-fields of the internal nature, the eye, etc. , because, like the illusory elephant, they are not existent, but are only perceived.

original: bar bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: bar bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: This is what is shown.

original: smig rgyu'i dpes kyang gang gi phyir snod kyi 'jig rten de rnams kyang de dang mtshungs pa'i phyir smig rgyu bzhin te /
analyzed: smig rgyu'i dpes kyang gang gi phyir snod kyi 'jig rten de rnams kyang de dang mtshungs pa'i phyir smig rgyu bzhin te /
translated: The example of a mirage is also like that, because the world of the container is similar to that, like a mirage.

original: yod pa ma yin na yang gdungs pa'i dbang gis chur dmigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin na yang gdungs pa'i dbang gis chur dmigs pa bzhin no //
translated: Although not existent, water is perceived due to the power of delusion.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i nye bar spyod pa'i gnyen po ni rmi lam gyi dpes te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i nye bar spyod pa'i gnyen po ni rmi lam gyi dpes te /
translated: The antidote to the enjoyment of form, etc. is the example of a dream.

original: des na rmi lam bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa 'di dag yod pa ma yin na yang de las byung ba'i 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i nye bar spyod pa yang de bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: des na rmi lam bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa 'di dag yod pa ma yin na yang de las byung ba'i 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i nye bar spyod pa yang de bzhin du bstan to //
translated: Therefore, like a dream, these forms, etc. are not existent, but the enjoyment of desire and aversion that arises from them is taught to be like that.

original: lus kyi las kyi gnyen por gzugs brnyan gyi dpe 'dra bar nye bar bstan te ;
analyzed: lus kyi las kyi gnyen por gzugs brnyan gyi dpe 'dra bar nye bar bstan te ;
translated: The example of a reflection is taught as the antidote to the karma of the body.

original: des na lus kyi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba la brten nas de las gzhan pa'i gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan 'byung ngo zhes ston to //
analyzed: des na lus kyi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba la brten nas de las gzhan pa'i gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan 'byung ngo zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that from the virtuous and nonvirtuous karma of the body, the reflection of another form arises.

original: ngag gi las kyi gnyen por ni brag ca dpe bstan te /
analyzed: ngag gi las kyi gnyen por ni brag ca dpe bstan te /
translated: The example of an echo is taught as the antidote to the karma of speech.

original: dag gi las kyi rgyu nyid las ngag gi las kyi 'bras bu brag ca lta bu nyid du des bstan to //
analyzed: dag gi las kyi rgyu nyid las ngag gi las kyi 'bras bu brag ca lta bu nyid du des bstan to //
translated: From the cause of the karma of speech, the result of the karma of speech is like an echo.üîΩThe karma of the mind is threefold: the level of equipoise, that which follows hearing, and that which is experienced in the desire realm.

original: yid kyi las ni rnam pa gsum ste mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa dang / thos pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / de la mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa gang yin pa'i gnyen por mig yor lta bu nyid ces bstan te /
analyzed: yid kyi las ni rnam pa gsum ste mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa dang / thos pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / de la mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa gang yin pa'i gnyen por mig yor lta bu nyid ces bstan te /
translated: The antidote to the karma of the mind that is not on the level of equipoise is taught to be like a mirage.

original: des ni mig yor lta bur zhes bya ba yid kyi las kyi 'bras bu bstan to //
analyzed: des ni mig yor lta bur zhes bya ba yid kyi las kyi 'bras bu bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that the result of the karma of the mind is like a mirage.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i yid kyi las kyi gnyen por ni chu zla'i dpe ste /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i yid kyi las kyi gnyen por ni chu zla'i dpe ste /
translated: The example of the moon in the water is the antidote to the mental karma of the level of meditative equipoise.

original: des ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pas yid kyi las ni chu'i zla ba dang 'dra'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: des ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pas yid kyi las ni chu'i zla ba dang 'dra'o zhes bstan to //
translated: That shows that the mental karma of the level of meditative equipoise is like the moon in the water.

original: thos pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i yid kyi las kyi gnyen por ni sprul pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: thos pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i yid kyi las kyi gnyen por ni sprul pa'i dpe ste /
translated: The example of emanations is the antidote to the mental karma that accompanies listening.

original: de la thos pa'i rjes su 'gro ba ni thos ba dang bsam pas bsgos pa'o //
analyzed: de la thos pa'i rjes su 'gro ba ni thos ba dang bsam pas bsgos pa'o //
translated: There, that which accompanies listening is imbued with listening and reflection.

original: des ni thos pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i yid kyi 'jug pa ni sgyu ma dang 'dra ba'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: des ni thos pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i yid kyi 'jug pa ni sgyu ma dang 'dra ba'o zhes bstan to //
translated: That shows that the mental engagement that accompanies listening is like an illusion.

original: ngo bo nyid gsum gyi mtshan nyid kyi chos kyi chos nyid de dag ji ltar mdo las 'byung ba dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum gyi mtshan nyid kyi chos kyi chos nyid de dag ji ltar mdo las 'byung ba dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: How do those dharmatƒÅs of phenomena, which have the characteristic of the three natures, accord with what appears in the s≈´tras?

original: da ni de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩtshangs pas zhus pa @153a * //
analyzed: da ni de bstan par bya ba'i phyir / tshangs pas zhus pa @153a * //
translated: Now, in order to teach that,üîΩthe Questions of Brahma S≈´tra says:

original: las bcom ldan 'das kyis ci las dgongs te /
analyzed: las bcom ldan 'das kyis ci las dgongs te /
translated: ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn, what were you thinking of when you said

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'khor ba yang ma dmigs mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma dmigs zhes bstan zhes bya ba gang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'khor ba yang ma dmigs mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma dmigs zhes bstan zhes bya ba gang /
translated: The TathƒÅgata has taught that ‚Äúsamsara is not apprehended and nirvana is not apprehended.‚Äù

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa nyid bye brag med pa las dgongs nas bstan zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa nyid bye brag med pa las dgongs nas bstan zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is taught with the intention that samsara and nirvana are not different.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni 'khor ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni 'khor ba ma yin te /
translated: The dependent nature is not samsara,

original: gang gi phyir de mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur bas so //
translated: because it becomes nirvana.

original: kun tu brtags pa'i chos ni de mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma yin te 'khor ba yin no //
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa'i chos ni de mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma yin te 'khor ba yin no //
translated: The imagined reality is not nirvana, but is samsara.

original: des na gcig pa nyid du brjod par mi nus par gzigs nas gcig nyid du zhugs pa'i bye brag gi ngo bo med pas 'khor ba yang mi dmigs la mya ngan las 'das pa yang mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni de las dgongs nas der gsungs pa yin
analyzed: des na gcig pa nyid du brjod par mi nus par gzigs nas gcig nyid du zhugs pa'i bye brag gi ngo bo med pas 'khor ba yang mi dmigs la mya ngan las 'das pa yang mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni de las dgongs nas der gsungs pa yin
translated: Therefore, seeing that it cannot be said to be the same, he said, ‚ÄúSamsara is not apprehended and nirvana is not apprehended,‚Äù because the nature of a difference that is a singularity does not exist. This is what was taught with that intention.

original: no // de bzhin du kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid do //
analyzed: no // de bzhin du kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid do //
translated: Similarly, the imagined nature is the reality of affliction.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rnam par byang ba nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rnam par byang ba nyid do //
translated: The perfected nature is the very purification.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni de dag gnyi ga'i bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid de /üîΩde la dgongs nas chos mngon pa'i mdo las chos ni gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni de dag gnyi ga'i bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid de / de la dgongs nas chos mngon pa'i mdo las chos ni gsum ste /
translated: The other-dependent nature is not the nature of both.üîΩWith that in mind, the Abhidharma S≈´tra teaches:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i char gtogs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i char gtogs pa dang / de gnyi ga'i char gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i char gtogs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i char gtogs pa dang / de gnyi ga'i char gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: There are three dharmas: those belonging to the category of defilement, those belonging to the category of purification, and those belonging to the category of both.

original: de yang gser gyi snying po can gyi sa'i dpes bstan te /
analyzed: de yang gser gyi snying po can gyi sa'i dpes bstan te /
translated: This is also taught by the example of the earth containing gold.

original: de la sa khong na gser yod pa zhes bya ba ni gser gyi sa bon no //
analyzed: de la sa khong na gser yod pa zhes bya ba ni gser gyi sa bon no //
translated: In this example, the ‚Äúearth containing gold‚Äù is the seed of gold.

original: sa'i khams ni sra ba nyid do //
analyzed: sa'i khams ni sra ba nyid do //
translated: The earth element is solidity.

original: sa ni nye bar rten pa'i gzugs sa'i kha dog gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sa ni nye bar rten pa'i gzugs sa'i kha dog gang yin pa ste /
translated: The earth is the color of the earth, which is the form that supports it.

original: de la gsum po de dag nye bar dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gsum po de dag nye bar dmigs pa yin no //
translated: These three are perceived there.

original: gser ni sa nyid du snang ba'o //
analyzed: gser ni sa nyid du snang ba'o //
translated: The gold is the appearance of the earth.

original: gnyis pa ni yod pa ste /

analyzed: des na de dag gnyi ga med pa dang yod par zhes gsungs pa yin te /

translated: The meaning is that the cognition of ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas is both obscured and unobscured.

analyzed: yod pa dang med pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid mchog tu rnam par dag pa ste /

analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid de ni mtshan nyid med pa'i chos te gang gi phyir re zhig 'di la dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni med de /

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad med pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad med pas so //

original: med pa'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin te /

original: mchog nyid du rtogs pas na mchog tu gshegs par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: mchog nyid du rtogs pas na mchog tu gshegs par mdzad pa ste /
translated: Because of supreme realization, one goes to the supreme.

analyzed: gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i don yin pa'i phyir 'gro ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa lhun gyis grub pa rgyun mi gcod par gnas pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa la dmigs nas gnas pa ste /

original: des rnam par gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des rnam par gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It has the meaning of ‚Äúremaining in that.‚ÄùüîΩThe quality of the cultivation of the antidote to all obscurations.

original: sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen po bsgoms pa'i yon tan dang zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen po 'di ltar dus thams cad du bsgom pa'i blo'o //üîΩ'jig rten du skyes kyang 'jig rten gyi chos kyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba la /

translated: It is the mind that always cultivates the antidote to all obscurations.üîΩEven though born in the world, not being affected by worldly dharmas.

original: de 'jig rten gyi spyod yul du 'jig rten du skyes pa yin na yang rnyed pa la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i chos kyis 'di ltar mi gos pa'o //
analyzed: de 'jig rten gyi spyod yul du 'jig rten du skyes pa yin na yang rnyed pa la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i chos kyis 'di ltar mi gos pa'o //
translated: Even though born in the world, the domain of the world, it is not affected by worldly dharmas such as gain.

original: chos rnam par gzhag pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa nyid dang / bsam gyis mi khyab ba nyid kyi mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos byis bas rtogs par dka' ba rnams mkhyen pas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: chos rnam par gzhag pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa nyid dang / bsam gyis mi khyab ba nyid kyi mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos byis bas rtogs par dka' ba rnams mkhyen pas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo mnga' ba ste /
translated: The quality of the teaching of the Dharma is the knowledge of the Dharma of the sutras, etc. , which is immeasurable and inconceivable, and which is difficult for the immature to understand.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig 'di dag ni tshigs so so thams cad la sbrel bar bya'o //üîΩphyi ma la chos 'byung ba mkhyen pa'i @156a * //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig 'di dag ni tshigs so so thams cad la sbrel bar bya'o // phyi ma la chos 'byung ba mkhyen pa'i @156a * //

original: yon tan zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyis ma 'ongs pa na chos 'di lta bu 'byung ngo zhes bya ba mkhyen pa'i tha tshig go //üîΩsku dpag tu med pas sems can 'dul ba sbyor ba'i yon tan zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lus dpag tu med pa gang gis sems can rnams 'dul bar mdzad pa ste /

original: des sangs rgyas las bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du shes pa 'thob pa dang / ye shes mnos pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid kyis gdul bya rnams la mdzad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: It is because of that that the Buddhas, having attained the equality of self and others with regard to the Buddha, and having taken up the gnosis, act for the disciples.

original: chos kyi sku mnyam pa la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams grub pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi sku ni chos kyi sku mnyam pa ste /

translated: The quality of the perfection of the Dharma Body is equality. The Dharma Body, which is nondual, is the equality of the Dharma Body.

original: de lta bas na 'dir gnyis su med pa'i sku shin tu rnam par dag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir gnyis su med pa'i sku shin tu rnam par dag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, here it is said that the perfection of the nondual, perfectly pure body is attained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa tha mi dad pa rnam par thar par mdzad par mdzad pa'i ye shes kyis mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa tha mi dad pa la mos par mdzad pa'i ye shes kyis mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba ste /

translated: The perfection of the knowledge which brings about the nondifferentiation of the Tathagatas is the perfection of the knowledge which brings about the nondifferentiation of the Tathagatas.

original: 'dir rnam par thar pa ni mos pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir rnam par thar pa ni mos pa'o //
translated: Here, liberation is faith.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum gyi yul yongs su chad pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum gyi yul yongs su chad pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba la /
translated: The quality of the domain of the Buddha's three bodies being unlimited is explained.

original: 'di ltar re zhig chos kyi sku'i yul ni 'di dag go zhes yongs su bcad par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig chos kyi sku'i yul ni 'di dag go zhes yongs su bcad par mi nus so //
translated: Thus, the domain of the Dharma Body cannot be limited by saying, It is this much.

original: de bzhin du longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku yang 'jig rten khams 'di snyed do zhes bcad par mi nus so //
analyzed: de bzhin du longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku yang 'jig rten khams 'di snyed do zhes bcad par mi nus so //
translated: Similarly, the domain of the Enjoyment Body and Transformation Body cannot be limited by saying, It is this many world systems.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi mchog ces bya ba ni gang 'dir rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyangs de ni mchog yin pas chos kyi dbyings de yang mchog yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi mchog ces bya ba ni gang 'dir rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyangs de ni mchog yin pas chos kyi dbyings de yang mchog yin no //
translated: The supreme of the ultimate realm is the supreme of the pure ultimate realm, and the ultimate realm is supreme.

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' ltar sangs rgyas ye shes mi zad pa'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' ltar sangs rgyas ye shes mi zad pa'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase up to the end of space means that the Buddha's wisdom is inexhaustible like space, and so it is said to have a completely pure understanding.

original: yang don gyi dbang du bya ba'i sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ba gzhan gyi don 'di ni las kyi tshig lhag ma bcu drug gis bstan te /
analyzed: yang don gyi dbang du bya ba'i sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ba gzhan gyi don 'di ni las kyi tshig lhag ma bcu drug gis bstan te /
translated: Moreover, the altruistic intention to bring about the benefit and happiness of all sentient beings who are the objects is taught by the remaining sixteen phrases of activity.

original: de la bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'i las ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: de la bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'i las ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is the activity of the altruistic intention to bring about happiness?

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la 'dzud pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la 'dzud pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is called ‚Äúintroducing them to the wisdom of omniscience.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar sems can de dag thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la 'dzud par gyur pas des kyang gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i sbyor bas mar me @156b gcig las mar med stong du gyur pa ltar bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa yang dag par bstanüîΩpar 'gyur ro //

translated: Thus, by introducing all those sentient beings to the wisdom of omniscience, that altruistic intention to bring about happiness is perfectly taught through the application of a transmission from one to another, like a single lamp becoming a thousand lamps.

translated: By abandoning attachment to dharmas means that as long as there is grasping at I and grasping at mine with regard to the dharmas that are heard and contemplated, there is no engagement.

translated: By abandoning conceptualization means that by not attending to any signs that are present in front, such as form, or that are imagined by one in meditative equipoise, such as a heap of bones, one engages by means of the method of non-conceptuality with regard to conceptualization.

analyzed: gzhan du rnam par rtog par gyur na 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //

original: gang gis ji ltar 'jug pa de bstan par bya ste /
